title: Searching!!!!!!!
text:
That’s all it ever does.  I have the Orbi WiFi throughout my house and it will choose the best frequency per device....however some of my speakers only connect to 2.4g while the other ones are placed on 5g. Bose refused to address this issue. As expensive as their products are. They will not help. They expect me to buy all new speakers. Every speaker in my house and truck are Bose. So disappointed. They are way behind in technology.  I hope your speakers doesn’t become lost on THEIR network because THEIR speakers can’t remember where to connect, you will get to run through a long drawn out process which includes resetting WiFi and setting up the speaker all over again. Coming from a guy who pushed their product for sound quality for years, it’s sad to say that their app and “connectabily” are horrible!! title: Solved all of our problems!!
text: Our problem were: trying to figure out a way to stream music in multiple rooms and have surround sound for the TV. We purchased a Bose Wave SoundTouch and a Bose SoundTouch 300. This got us exactly what we wanted and they communicate over our wireless network so setup was really easy and fast. Bose does not do a good job of making it clear that these two products can work together. It is clearly stated that the Bose Wave SoundTouch works in conjunction with the Bose SoundTouch 10, 20, and 30, but not clear about the SoundTouch 300 sound bar, bass and rear speakers. Even the very unhelpful store employees told us that these products would not work together. I did some research online while in the store and came to the conclusion that the employees were wrong. We took the chance and bought both and am glad we did. They work perfectly together. We can play music in one room, watch TV in the other, stream the same music in both rooms, or different music in both rooms. The system is very flexible like that. The app is easy to use and works great. Sound quality is what you would expect from a product bearing the Bose name. Very happy with the purchases.

title: Happy together with Bose SoundTouch
text: I am absolutely thrilled with the Bose SoundTouch system. I have been a huge supporter of Bose for many, many years. I still have the Bose 901 speakers that I sacrificed to purchase while in college and survived on peanut butter sandwiches to ensure that I could make the purchase. It was more than a purchase, it was an investment in amazing quality soundI am originally from New York City and enjoyed listening to WQXR which is the classical radio station for the New York Times via my Bose speakers. I have a grown-up with the Bose quality line of superior music products and have proudly added the SoundTouch system to my collection. This is an amazing system, I highly recommend it to everyone even my friends who have invested heavily in other products like Sonos. There is no comparison. I will remain a faithful Bose audiophile and look forward to adding additional sound touch speakers to our home to expand this footprint. Thank you for this wonderful, wonderful product that has made my husband and I for both engineers extremely happy.

title: Speaker good... software is SOOO frustrating
text:
Speaker sound quality great. The software and daily use of this renders it absolutely useless. The app and firmware have to constantly be updated to work as advertised. It seams like every other time I try to connect to my speaker in the living room. It does not work. I have stop what I’m doing and spend what feels like 30 mins screwing with it to get it to work. I have to go through every speaker and app. Half the time I have to call a buddy over and use his time to get it working. Also, It’s another email password you have to remember. Which is a pain for friends that only come over once every 6 months and want to play their play list.  I wish I had not bought this stuff. Just want to go back to plugging a wire in. At least that works every time without fail. I don’t like leaving negative reviews. But I bought this to have something cool to present every 2 or 3 months to show off and enjoy... without fail, this has disappointed me and disappointment is what comes to mind every time I see the word BOSE now...
If this is the same system all WiFi speakers have... Stay away from them. Save your $ and quality speakers that don’t have the WiFi feature. It’s and expensive lesson to learn otherwise.

title: Nice update. Still needs some work.
text:
Just updated the app. It can now send AUX to any speaker. Don't know what the big deal was. Something having to do with licensing? But no license for Bluetooth rebroadcast? 
The ability to rebroadcast needs more work. I love this ability...if only it were better. I have 3 SoundTouch speakers. The only one that video syncs is the one physically connected to the video source (TV AUX out). But when I try to bring up the second then 3rd speaker, it rebroadcasts, but it drops. And when the drops stop, the audio is distractinglily delayed. It does say it's a beta version so hopefully Bose reads these. 
I went from a Logitech squeeze box network, to sound touch and I love it. Richer sound and It's more stable. Only one wish: can you do something about the preset memory buttons? There are only six. Why not allow the ability to save individually? Meaning I have 3 radios. Each have six presets. For those of use with more than one unit, why not allow me to combine them, that gives me presets for 18 stations! Logitech allows you to do that. But not Bose? If it's an issue for some, why not make it a selective option for the user?

title: Pandora continually stops playing
text:
Yes, it would be nice if more platforms were supported… That said, the platforms that are supported should work consistently. I have had an ongoing problem that I have reported multiple times where Pandora will play one song then the app freezes. I have to turn it off and turn it back on. It will then begin playing in the middle of the last song and if I don’t skip to the next song, it will freeze again. This will happen multiple times a day every day. It may then play five songs in a row just fine and freeze again. Sometimes, it will play for an hour or more before this starts. Then, I may go three or four days where it works just fine. Then, it will randomly start again. I’ve done everything from factory resets to creating new accounts from scratch. It has done this on multiple WiFi networks. If I use the speaker has Bluetooth, it’s just )so long as I’m within Bluetooth range).
I have had this speaker for years and it worked flawlessly until about a year or so ago. I originally intended to buy more speakers and expand. I think I will have to start over and spend my money on Sonos instead.

title: Big learning curve
text:
I am a Bose fan. I think Bose is the best. We have music in every room in our house. We even have a speaker in our master closet. 

This system does not work with a mesh network. We accept this and have improvised. We have Google Fiber 1 gig. This many speakers (16) need an excellent signal. We have a dedicated router (non mesh) for the Bose system as well. The speakers also need a fast signal. We have the router separating 2.4ghz and 5ghz. We only use the 5ghz. A 5ghz signal, while much faster than 2.4 ghz, doesn’t travel as far as 2.4ghz. The system in our house needs the speed of 5ghz. While there is some fade at 1 outlying speaker, I love this system. It can be quirky. We’ve had this system for several years now. It has been frustrating (extremely) at times. I just had to accept that it WILL NOT WORK with our Orbi Network. It confuses the speaker system. I’ve had to work with this and have improvised as stated earlier. 

If you are willing to work with this system’s limitations, it can be wonderful. It’s taken me years to figure it out. I’m still learning and Bose continues to work on issues with the app. 

Bose customer service is excellent. Even when I’ve called in a bit grumpy, they really do care and want their customers to be happy with their products. They will do their best to find a solution.

I hope this review is helpful to others. It comes from lots of experience. Have a nice day and stay well.

title: Great App Needs Refining
text:
First the app is great; it’s come a long way, with that said the ability to search for a particular artist, album, or song when connected to your “Music Library” via your computer would be a GREAT addition. It’s annoying having to scroll from songs with the number 1 all the way to the “Ms” just to get to an album that starts with the letter M. 

Secondly, the app splitting songs up based on whether or not there’s a featured artist on the song is irritating. I find a album after having to manually scroll thru all albums to get to it to only then find out that only 6 of the 13 songs are displayed because the other 7 have featured artist i.e.; I select Lloyd’s album “Tru” and only 4 songs display yet if I go back to the album selection page there’s 6 additional songs by Lloyd that appear such as; Lloyd [Featuring Rick Ross] that do not show up under the actual album “Tru” simply because there’s a featured artist on the actual song therefore I have to go back and forth to play the full album.

Fixing these issues would make the app a 5 for me.

text:

title: Fake reviews?

title: Awesome possum!
text: Decides to go for the gold and bought the Bose SoundTouch 300 Tv sound bar and matching Bluetooth base. We got a free SoundTouch 10 with the purchase. Didn’t really know what I was getting when I bought it. When I realized that the devices themselves attached to the WiFi and played from your favorite music service I was blown away. title: Best Purchase!!
text:
I’ve had this in my house for about 3 years now and I still love this system. I get compliments from my guest all the time on how cool it is. I have a speakers all throughout my home which is the equivalent of a different zone for those that paid the hefty price for hardwired home surround sonos system they can be somewhat limited with this. title: Don’t forget to read the instructions
text: I made a mistake an delete the app and had to start over .  And I actually didn’t need too. After reinstalling the app it didn’t work. I didn’t need to start from scratch all I needed was to reconnect  to the speaker. title: Not worthy of Bose
text: I love my Bose radio, but this app is absolute crap. When I stream an Internet radio station through it, the signal drops every 3-4 months for pockets of about 20 seconds at a time, while the label on the radio says "loading." The problem is not my Internet connection; I know that, because for years I have streamed the same station on my laptop, and I never had to deal with interruptions. Also... when I use the notebook version of the app, it often says, for no obvious reason, that my iTunes library isn't available, and the only solution is to shut down the app, shut down iTunes, and restart both. (And even then, sometimes the situation isn't resolved until I install whatever SoundTouch update just became available -- it seems every day there is a new one, as constant nagging messages remind me). Lastly, the app does not let you stream podcasts, which is a sad limitation for this type of app. If you want to listen to a podcast, you have to download it on your notebook or PC (not your phone..), add it to an iTunes playlist, and stream it from your iTunes library (which by the way, won't refresh while the app is running). My 19-year-old nephew could have designed a better app.

title: Bose SoundTouch App
text: The app takes a bit of getting used to but it works very well. Selection of albums, tracks and artists are available using the search function. Transmitting the sound to various devices in different rooms is easy enough but you need strong broadband for it to work continuously. Using the system during the peak “movie viewing evening period” can be frustrating. I like too, that I can select international wi-fi radio stations and pair them with 6 buttons on the SoundTouch devices. FM radio stations can also be paired to these 6 buttons. However, the SoundTouch Wireless Link Adapter does not have presets but it does allow the addition of Bluetooth pairing to the system. The Bose Wave also has Bluetooth pairing as does 3rd generation SoundTouch speakers. All pulled together, it makes a fine multi room system when several SoundTouch units are added and synced with the app, and played in unison. Some Bose SoundTouch tv speakers can also be controlled and added with the app. Bose have made significant grades to the app from time to time.

title: Great when it works, horrible otherwise
text: I have two soundtouch speakers to play in stereo, however here’s the catch. If I want them to play in stereo I have to do 15 mins of setup. Every. Single. Time. Every week there’s a new update for god knows what which will take anywhere from 5-15 mins, then I have to spent 10-15 extra mins trying to get the things to play together. The setup requires you to connect to the speaker, then connect the speaker to your WiFi and then connect your phone back to the WiFi which isn’t that hard to do seeing as it only takes 5 mins but then I have to do it again so it takes ten minutes in total. That, in addition to weekly updates means that the average setup time to play my music is 10-25 mins, 10 mins isn’t bad. But 25 is. And that’s not all, if I setup it will only work while I am using it. If I use it for more than an hour or so or stop using it and come back later, I will have to go through the setup again. WHY DO THEY HAVE TO CONNECT TO WIFI????????

title: Constantly confounded by how poor this app is
text:
I love Bose, when it comes to sound quality there's no question that they're systems are some of the best around. I was so eager to get these that I sold my almost new Sonos speakers and replaced them with these. Too bad the Sonos app and speaker capability is FAR superior to Bose. These speakers have connectivity issues on an almost daily basis. I constantly have to unplug them and plug them in again for the app to 'see' the speaker and for them to be able to network together. This is annoying, more so when you've paid over $1000 for a system. 
Additionally, basic features like a sleep function and alarm clock would also be nice (all available with the Sonos). The connectivity issues and extremely basic app aren't befitting of the brand and over a year later I'm still waiting for basic improvements. Very disappointing.

title: I'm a Bose Fanatic !
text:
My home is full of Bose products.  From the series 1   901,s stored in the garage to the five speaker Home Theater System.

Re: Sound Touch.

I have every model in my home and feel that I could make a few user comment.

Model 10. I have a pair in my bedroom. I Listen to them every night and morning.  I decided recently that I wanted to play my flat screen tv through them.  Checking the owners manual I could find information on this setup.  Called the tech line and was told that to do so I would have to separate right and left and use the aux inputs.  Turns out that the 10's don't have a stereo function when in aux mode.  Operating the 10's as two separate speakers the remote tries to operate both.  I gave up. Mayhaps if I add Bluetooth to my my tv I could do it.

20's, 30's and Wave Clock Radio. Use them almost every day.

Main System: I have it connected to my Bose home theatre system.   The theater system has been tuned to the room using The provided computer balance system.  Room sounds great! 

Here's the rub,  the Sound Touch Main system favors the right channel and the home theater and the main unit offer no right / left balance. 

System:  all of my units occasionally drop out for a few seconds.  The interesting thing is that not all the systems fail at the same time.  I feel I have good internet service but the dropouts are annoying.

I will continue to favor Bose products.......Nothing better.

title: Excellent.
text:
This is one of the most robust, well thought through and full of features app i have ever used. I can say that who so ever designed the app and chose features simply used common sense and added what ever users may need in this app. Quality of speakers add to the experience by playing music flawlessly without any delay on all speakers you choose. 
Ability to play same song on multiple speakers at the same time and create play groups on the fly with such an ease through app UI is marvelous. Simple and well thought through app. You will find controls exactly where they should have been. No need to tweak a lot of knobs in settings or navigate through multiple screens to achieve something. I love this app and its simplicity. It takes care of a lot of things on its own. Adding a new speaker is so simple. They simply used common sense and app turned out so great.

title: Fantastic except...
text: I can't speak enough to how happy I am with my SoundTouch 10's.  Have 3 and will most likely get another. Being able to have music everywhere I go, inside and outside of my home, whether all playing the same or something different is fantastic.  Unfortunately I've recently run into a disappointing problem when streaming shows.  They have the capacity to combine and play in stereo, which sounds even better when playing music but when synchronized and watching a streaming show, they fall behind.  A delay.  Sound is fantastic but you can see mouths moving before you hear the audio. Which is...well, annoying.  I sincerely hope there is a fix for this.  Using just one when streaming works just fine, fortunately so I will continue to enjoy them and highly recommend this product.

title: Frustrating and not very useful
text:
Connection with my radio is slow and unresponsive, although improved over earlier versions. Browsing music through my NAS library sometimes works, sometimes slowly, sometimes not at all. Completely random, as far as I can tell, and unrelated to my home network status. The library search function is a joke - as near as I can tell when searching capitalization has to be exactly as in the album, artist or track name, and can only search from the beginning of those fields (e.g. when searching for “Can’t Buy Me Love” you must search for Can’t Buy Me Love - the terms “love” or “Buy Me” for example will return NO RESULTS).
Added functionality of being able to switch to Radio receiver and presets would be nice; why is this not present already? Intuitively it should be there. 
I cannot fathom how this app gets almost 5 stars as an average. I literally hate this app and only use it because I really have no choice if I want to be able to use all the smart functions of the radio. Fix it.

title: Horrible connectivity - so disappointed with Bose
text:
I too am surprised at a 4.7 rating, simply cannot be true.  We have 3 Bose SoundTouch speakers, purchased at different times over last couple of years.  I bought them because I want to be able to control with my phone.  Two of the speakers are placed on shelves near ceiling.  I can never just pick up my phone and control with the ST app.  I must go through, on average 30 minutes of reconnecting speakers to the internet and even then they don’t stay connected.  My sister has a Sonos system and never ever has had the experience I’ve had with these Bose.  We are Bose people and have several other Bose products, Waves, surround sound, etc.  We are happy with all of our other products but the SoundTouch has caused literally hours of frustration!  I wish Bose would do something about this problem!
I cannot recommend this speaker system to anyone else.

title: Whatever was in that update made it worse

I hope this isn’t the beginning of the end for support for these devices that I really haven’t had that long and spent a lot of money on. title: Extremely unreliable
text: I give this two stars only because it’s a good concept, but unless you enjoy your music turning off and on randomly and constantly having to power cycle the speakers and reset your WiFi, don’t bother with this system. Sadly if you’re reading this you’ve probably already bought the speakers. If you can still return them, do it. My husband thought for the longest time that my problems were user error but now he’s witnessed it too. Most commonly the speakers will just quit playing but sometimes they’re more creative. One speaker out of six might randomly switch to another station. A speaker may be playing but not know that it is, so you can’t adjust the volume. The most fun is when a speaker that was not playing decides to come on with whatever you were listening to last... invariably it’s Muse coming on in the nursery while the baby is napping. We’ve used this in three houses now so it’s not our internet that’s the problem. I’m about ready to toss the whole thing out the window.

title: Improve app settings
text: Sounds very good!  I've been a fan of Bose for 22yrs.  Had the old Bose wave, old 5.1 systems "10" and "15", and in car systems, etc. I now have the 300 sound bar, sub, and surround speakers.  It would be nice if the app could control the subwoofer volume.  The app controls the volume of the center and surround speakers why not have the app control the subwoofer also.  I find the app has the capability to control features that the remote cannot and the remote controls features the app cannot.  This makes it difficult to make tv, aux, and Bluetooth changes. Please incorporate all functions of the system on one or the other. Fumbling between the app and remote is very inconvenient and confusing at times when on the fly.  4 stars because of app/remote functionality. Definitely 5 star sound.

title: The Most Useless App of all Time!
text: There I said it! Each time I turn the speaker off and then turn it on (either a minute or an hour or a day later, it does not matter), the app cannot find my speaker, so I have to setup the system again, and again, and again, and yet again! How come Bose came up with such a useless app? And this thing has been in the market for so long, people have been complaining about for that long, and Bose has not provided a single solution as yet! I have not experienced such an unresponsive technical/customer team! Like the app, these teams are in a perpetual silence mode; app does not deliver, the services don’t respond, nor solve the problem! I am sure they do not understand what the problem is, or they don’t care! I just listen music using Bose as loudspeakers! What a waste! If you buy Bose Soundtouch, don’t ever download the app, because it does not work, just use the bluetooth connection!

title: Unrealiable app - poor interface and frequent crashes
text:
Bose SoundTouch ecosystem has been overall a very disappointing and gruelling experience.
Not only will the app frequently crash (either on OSX or iOS) but the much touted PLAY ALL function that is supposed to allow seamless multi speaker playback simply does not work reliably causing the need to frequently restart speakers, routers and iOS device. 
Further the soundtouch app seems to interfere with the wifi management on iOS as opening will sometimes cause the iOS device to lose its wifi connectivity causing multiple error messages within the app.
Bose support is generally not reachable and when they are they also tend to be quite defensive and try to push back the blame on the user system rather than really help to solve the problem. For reference I recommend potential soundtouch system buyers to first check the Bose community forum under the “Play All” key words - very educational reading on the actual performance of the system and how Bose handles consumer support...

title: Love my BOSE!!
text: I’ve had the privilege of owning many Bose products and the quality is beyond measure. I could write a full length review but I’ll keep it short. I own the Bose SoundTouch and pairing it with the app makes it a breeze to use. I can save my favorite stations or playlists from SiriusXM, Pandora & Tidal! If you’ve never owned a Bose, you’re missing out! The sound, oh em gee, the sound is crisp and clear highlighting every note & instrument. When you purchase a Bose you can rest assured that you’ve made an investment in a product that holds its value with the best sound that never diminishes. Now with the SoundTouch app, it’s easy to pair all of your Bose devices creating a home theater system like no other. I highly recommend Bose products! Bose does NOT disappoint!!!

title: Refusal to add source switching
text: After years, literally years- at least 2, of complaints by customers to be able to switch sources via the app, Bose still won’t implement such a change. So for instance if you play something through AirPlay or Bluetooth, then switch to watch a movie, you can’t hear anything unless and only if you have their remote. If you lose the remote you are stuck with the AirPlay or Bluetooth source unless you buy their $50 remote. And while you can program a universal remote to control basic functions, source switching is not a function available for universal remotes. This appears to be a pattern by bose. After they announced they would add AirPlay 2 to the SoundTouch, they took 3 years, yes THREE years, to finally release an update for it. No concern for customers after they’ve spent hundreds or thousands of dollars on their products. I own a lot of Bose products but now when shopping for new audio equipment I literally scroll past anything Bose.

title: Sound is Amazing. CEC Control still has issues
text: The sound quality is second to none. Updating the firmware on the SoundTouch300 while it’s connected to my TV is not a flawless operation though. My gut instinct tells me this is probably related to having my SoundTouch300 connected via CEC Control. My SoundTouch300 always gets “hung up” while updating firmware and I’m forced to unplug/replug power to the SoundTouch300 to get the update to finish. Also, my SoundTouch app never displays the percentage complete during a SoundTouch300 firmware update. After I’ve cycled power to the SoundTouch300, the SoundTouch app almost instantly displays 100% complete. Still, the sound quality from the SoundTouch300 is amazing so issues with updating firmware are not that big of an inconvenience to me. Considering the amazing sound quality and minor firmware updating issues, I rate the SoundTouch app 4/5 stars.

title: Everything you need
text: Sound is outstanding! I'm all in with 6 speakers: mini, 20's, a 30, sound bar, and Soundtouch Wave..to play CDs...the soundbar 300 with sub woofer is best for television and music a like. The 5 presets on the Bose speakers are very convenient as you don't need a device to start/stop your speakers, when synced the primary speaker acts as the master...can shut all off with..one touch. Just make sure you have a Wifi router with some power, I had upgraded the internet speed (as I was building out my system) with a provided TWC combo modem/router which created issues with the system...delay in syncing the speakers, can not find speakers, no internet connection. At first thought it was the Bose app...it's not. Traded out for a dedicated modem and purchased a Nighthawk 600 wifi Router, back to 100%.

title: Much Better - Bugs Fixed?
text:
Some time ago, a SoundTouch update rendered our system unusable. We had our music stored on an old SeagateMedia NAS and we use Google Mesh Routers in our house. For some reason, SoundTouch could not access our NAS and we were advised to replace it.

So I bought a Western Digital NAS at Bose Support’s recommendation. After installation and copying our music files to the new device, SoundTouch couldn’t access it either. Repeated tries were useless. I pretty much gave up and started exploring other, non Bose options.

Then one day we got a SoundTouch update and like magic, we can play music from all of our devices, accessing libraries from either NAS. It was a painful experience but we are now happy with our system.

title: Sometimes frustrating
text:
Problem solved? 
My router puts out two networks, a regular one and a -5G. My phone will connect to one of the two when I arrive back home, but apparently the SoundTouch 20 is only connected to the regular one. The app will work for a up to ten seconds on the -5G network then it says “no WiFi connection”. I can force quit the app and relaunch. It’ll work again for a few seconds and error again, occasionally it will automatically reconnect but again for just a few seconds. Made me think the app was buggy.
It seems I have to manually ensure I’m on the regular network for it to work properly. Don’t want to have to tell my phone to forget the -5G network, but it’d be a viable solution. Maybe this tip will help someone else frustrated by this.

title: Fantastic interface!!!
text:
I have enjoyed more than a half hour jumping around between Bluetooth, email, apps,WiFi, routers, passwords, password resets, error codes, more passwords, account settings, error connecting messages and FINALLY................. I said to my self what a wonderfully difficult and tedious way to try and listen to internet radio. It looks like I will work in silence for today as my attempts have been futile and my temper has risen to new highs. I will make an effort to connect another time maybe weeks in the future. 
I do have another brand of speaker that will connect to anyone’s phone in three taps but I really want to suffer with this Bose app until it finally works.

title: Bose has improved markedly
text: I bought my unit for myself for my birthday late 2016. It worked great for a while then it just went downhill. Never worked when I tried to use it. So I just stopped. Although I do believe it had 100% to do with my cable modem communication but no one wanted to admit it. Regardless, after this last move, it’s worked not just perfectly, but immediately upon turning it on. After this last update (iOS 11.2.2) and Bose update to both iPhone 7+ and iPad Pro) it’s without fail. And all night. Incoming messages don’t interrupt playing, incoming calls don’t interrupt playing, incoming anything doesn’t interrupt anything and it’s seamless. I sleep with it on all night and it’s perfect sound, which Bose is known for, gives me perfect rest. I’m so happy I didn’t sell it when I started to get frustrated and stuck with it. Thanks for making an amazing product, Bose!!

title: Spruce goose
text: This giant expense is a poor performer.  I have spent hours trying to get a device to connect multiple times during the 3 years we have used this app and system.  Finicky would be a generous description.  Between the music getting dropped and speakers getting dropped, I am kept busy troubleshooting. Plan on an hour or two to reconnect a speaker. Believe me, I could write the book on the steps to connect and I usually have to try a dozen or more times before the equipment will work.  I own at least one of each of the different devices- maybe thats the problem, I don’t know. Heaven forbid it happens during a gathering. After covid calms and we start having parties I will NOT be able to rely on SoundTouch. We have spent $1000s on Bose equipment- Is it too much to ask to just be able to turn on music?  Can anyone tell me how to use the system without a network but without the app????  Address that Bose!!! Give me internet free contol

title: App is sub-par to product
text: I have gotten so frustrated with this app and its connectivity issues that I was inclined to write a review hoping that someone at Bose actually sees and acts on its issues. Been a fan of Bose for many years and have several Bose products in the household because of their exceptional sound quality; however, the app is a constant failure - with the several timely firmware updates required often, you would think the issues would have been resolved, but nope, it seems like it’s something different each time. Connectivity is confusing and very temperamental, I can never know if I need to use wifi, bluetooth, airplay or aux (however I’m supposed to do that in wireless times) to connect and when it actually does connect, it’ll stop streaming mid-song where I need to restart the confusing connection process all over again - most times I don’t even bother and move on because it’s not worth the time.

title: New stability fix a (continued) dud
text:
If I could unwind 5 Years I would not buy Bose. At that time we bought a SoundTouch 20 for our small house. Routinely buggy interface but good quality sound.

Moved to a bigger home a couple years back and decided we wanted synchronized radio & music as we moved between kitchen & living / dining areas.

We stayed in the Bose family as it seemed unlikely we could easily integrate a different device. Bought a Soundtouch 10 for the kitchen. Oops.

A typical session involves restarts of one or both devices, exit & re-entry of i6-based app, and surrender to use of one device to eliminate unsynced delays of maybe half to a full second. The iPad app seems to work a bit better for some reason though all are connected to a seemingly strong Wi-Fi signal.

Sometimes I lose control of one device & sometimes both. The 10 drops out for 5 seconds every 15 to 40 minutes for no apparent reason. If I use the handheld for volume it seems the app gives up and only a restart allows volume control from the app.

Very friendly tech support people have walked me through the a purge & reprogram process (about 30 minutes). I was able to regain intermittent control (described above) after I’d lost it completely when the 20 spontaneously reconnected to an alternate wi-fi signal we’d run it through about a year back.

I’m baffled that others report such clean success and envy their good fortune.

title: Great App, could still be better
text: I really enjoy the quality of the sound.  The Lifestyle 523 Series III is over two yrs old & has had no problems. The TV interface is simple & straight forward.  Playing through my computer on iTunes works well.  One can select various playlists from iTunes.  I use the app on my iPad, it is less than intuitive, however with a little persistence it works out fine.  Working with the App give you more choices than with the TV display.  I look forward to adding additional WiFi speakers throughout the house.  I’ve had great help with customer service when I’ve needed it, which is not often.  I strongly recommend the app, & the hardware.  It’s a great package for quality sound & versatility. If you have questions on anything give customer service a call.

title: Almost great.
text: Just got a Bose SoundTouch 30 and setting this up with the app (which did its job nicely on that) The app overall has a clean interface and is easy to use although I have two small complaints that hopefully will be addressed. #1 When playing a song through an Internet Station I wish the name of the song would show up on the app, it will on the staions app, but i I'm goingto use my new device it would be nice to not have to go someplace top get the name & artist if I hear something new I like. #2 When listening to a song on my music library through the Bose App I cannot jump to parts of a song or skip around, this can be done using the Apple Music App, but I feel that is something I should be able to do through the Bose App. If these small things can be fixed, it's a 5 Star App.

title: Does not work well at all
text:
Very disappointed with the way this works, I should say not-work most of the time.

First issue is that all the time the app needs an update and all the speakers need an update. This takes 20 minutes for each speaker, so should you decide to turn your music on for a dinner party, it will be cold by the time you are done doing this update procedure. I think I own 5 of these nose speakers for about 2 years now and I have updated them more than 30 times.

This is really annoying because this seems to be my total user experience. The updates are not optional. You have to update before anything plays. Very often I just give up now because it just seems like Bose can never get their app to be sufficient quality that an update becomes “optional”

Well, then when it is finally updated, sometimes it works , sometimes it does not. Depends on what settings got lost during the update (I have had to regroup the speaker groups a dozen times ). Depends on whatever else . Time of the day, weather? They are on a wired network so it has no Wi-Fi excuses.

Speakers drop out regularly and it is not clear at all how to get back on to play

It just seems this is designed to be single speaker Bluetooth setup. The “whole house audio “ concept is completely a pain in the neck. Unfortunately I invested in all these Bose speaker to just do that :(

title: Won’t connect
text: I’m a networking engineer and have been battling this app for years.  Go online and so has just about everyone else.  Note that there are somehow 5 star reviews in here for people who clearly can’t get the app to work and the text in those reviews suggests a much lower rating.  Weird.  Anyway, I’ve tried multiple iOS devices over the years, repeatedly reset (to factory at times) the speakers and even the router (should NEVER have to even be tempted to do that), shut off my 5G network ... on and on.   This Christmas we could only have music over Bluetooth in one room ... hardly the point of having a wireless system.  I’m getting rid of all this stuff and moving to Sonos.  My friends never have connectivity issues and if you go through the internet, you’ll find *everyone* has these problems with Bose.  This is going to cost me a fortune, but I am done.  Bose doesn’t even seem to care.

This app deserves five stars but my simple reason for giving it four starts is what Bose did in the last upgrade they took away the internet option of searching the internet for your radio stations and forcing you to used tune in radio for your search engine that’s not good tune in does carry all the radio stations so you basically lost all your saved stations from the internet

title: Bose update
text: I have had several bose soundtouch Systems over the past 12 years. I love them. However in July 2018 the speakers were unable to connect to play any of my itunes music or any music on my apple devices. I was very frustrated after spending $599 for the Soundtouch III System. I was on the phone hours with a technician and it still did not work. I was through with Bose at that point and felt like I had wasted on $599. I wanted to sell the system on Ebay but was not sure if it was broken or not. But once  apple launched the ios12 update, Bose updated the speakers and they finally work after 4 months of no music. This was a very frustrating ordeal. It will certainly make me think twice about purchasing the Soundtouch IV.

title: Superior Sound and Functionality
text:
Been looking for some speakers for the apartment that would allow me to play music from my phone+computer. The computer and TV speakers just weren’t cutting it anymore.

After reading up on similar speakers, I narrowed down my options to Sonos and Bose. Sonos boasts integrated Alexa functionality but we aren’t big Google/Amazon ecosystem users at home. Even so, I imagine that integrated feature can be very convenient.

Coupled with Bluetooth, the Wi-Fi capability was a big selling point. At the price of these and similar speakers, I imagine a lot of folks are looking at audio fidelity. I was pretty surprised at the augmented quality playing audio through Wi-Fi versus Bluetooth. Having both connectivity options will definitely come in handy.

 Very happy with this purchase. I opted for two speakers so the stereo field is a truly pleasant listening experience.

Last, I am a huge fan of the tactile buttons as another control option. While I’ll probably do most of the controlling via phone/app, I can appreciate the availability and superior quality of the buttons on the speakers. 

Thank you, Bose!

title: Amazing sound and ease of use!!
text:
I purchased the Bose SoundTouch 30 to replace the old surround sound system I had in my office. I use it for gaming and music. I knew it would have great sound because it is a Bose, but I didn’t know it would sound as good or better than my current home theater system. I placed it in front of my entertainment center to play music for an event because the surround system is more difficult to play music from my iPhone. Everyone was shocked at the depth and quality of the sound it produced.

My surround sound system is a recent denon receiver with Boston Accoustics speakers and a klipsch 12” subwoofer.

The Bose SoundTouch 30 has better highs, midrange, and sub!

title: Your app before and now
text:
I do enjoy using your app although recently I tried to upgrade my wireless router to a Linksys high powered model and after countless tries my wirelessly connected iPad and iPhone using the app would not "see" any soundtouch units.  Switching back to my providers wifi, it immediately found my systems. 
I do have one criticism. I realize you've changed the app to be more in line with your other apps but the previous COLOR app was very appealing. Perhaps in a future release you could rethink the starkness of black and white.  Also thank you for putting back recently played.  I'd like to see more presets on the app. I understand the physical limit on the systems themselves but within the app this would not be a difficult add. 
Thank you for listening.

title: Sound touch is incredible
text:
I bought the sound touch system for my whole house. A few “hifi experts” told me it was a mistake and I should buy a proper system with dedicated amplifiers and speakers. 
I am soooo Glad I bought the sound touch. I got the in ceiling speakers and the sound is absolutely amazing. My family and I listen so often and the ease of use  encourages to listen to our music. My Wife who was unhappy about a sound system and the last system we had was a well known amplifier system with speakers now lives the Bose sound touch.
My advice is not to listen to so called hifi experts and make your own decision but first listen to the Bose SoundTouch system . Absolutely amazing!!!

title: SoundTouch 300
text:
Great sound quality for the size. It’s very clean. It definitely needs good quality sound input however. Any source where the sound is marginal is very audible in the sound quality. Great bass response for the size too with no audible distortion at any volume level.

Connectivity needs improvement however. I am tech savvy but this thing is a pain to setup and often does not connect to a source on the first or even the second try. No sound is emitted unless there is a delay in sequencing from the source. This could likely be fixed with a software upgrade. Some people setting the system up may give up if they are not very patient. 

Sound quality via Bluetooth is surprisingly excellent once you get it to connect.

title: App doesn’t work with any consistency
text: I have used this app frequently and it has never worked consistently. Every time that I use it, either the app needs an update or the speakers need updating - I have two SoundTouch 20s and one SoundTouch 10, one speaker on each floor of my townhouse. I looked forward to being able to play them all as a set, as advertised, to have music throughout my house and I have gotten them to work together exactly once in two years. I always end up having to delete and re-add the speakers to get even basic functions to work, let alone getting them to work in sync. I expect better from a brand like Bose.  When I do re-add the speakers, I find that I have to redo all of my presets as well. It is extremely frustrating and I fall back to using the individual remotes.

title: Really like SoundTouch
text:
Received A SoundTouch speaker for Christmas, which was great because this was not something I would have bought for myself. But now that we have it, we really enjoy it. The speaker has been very reliable, and I enjoy being able to listen to more variety than our over the air radio provides.
The software on the iPad and iPhone works very well. I would say better, no, much better than average. Occasionally the software will update and every update has been successful. This is the type of product I enjoy using. Which is to say, I do not need to mess around with the configurations. Once it is set up, it is set up and good to go.

title: Excellent product, decent app
text:
The Bose sound touch is an excellent product. Great highs & lows, easy setup, and overall great room-filling sound. 

The app is not revolutionary, but it gets the job done. It makes the setup a bit easier. You set a preset by dragging & dropping a station to one of the preset numbers. Those numbers match the hardware buttons on the unit. 

I have had some of the same issues that other users have reported where occasionally I'll start the app on my iPhone 6S & it'll say it can't find the stereo, even though both my phone & the stereo are connected via the same wifi network. I've tested this extensively by turning off the cell phone radio on my phone, only having wifi enabled, confirming I can surf the Internet, while music is playing on the stereo. It seems that when my phone has issues finding the stereo, my wife's iPhone7 doesn't have any issues connecting. I suspect a bug with AirPlay, but I've never encountered this issue with other products (like our AirPlay printer). Rebooting the stereo almost always fixes the problem. 

We use the stereo daily. It's the best addition to our house.

title: Fantastic app....when it’s working properly
text: Bose has a clean app with all the basic needs covered. Wish there was just a way to keep the WiFi connection enabled all the time. I am Frustrated with having to set up the app more often lately as it loses connection to my Bose SoundTouch 300 sound bar. It seems to take about 20 mins or so to finally get back on to normal functionality. There is no answer or “true fix” for this either as Bose claims it’s a hardware issue. All that aside the app is actually easy to use and navigate. Clean interface as well. Some custom features would be useful like skipping ahead in the current song. Aldo would like a feature to create playlists on the app directly. Maybe this is a license thing but all else seems to be unremarkable.

title: WiFi
text: Don’t bother with this app. The app says speakers need updating every time you open the app. Then the speaker signal won’t connect to your device, so you spend 30+ minutes trying to get them connected. Once they connect, for me, they won’t pick up a signal to play anything. Tried contacting support when my speakers wouldn’t update- what a joke! I spent the first 20 minutes with Marvin walking me through steps to connect the speakers to my device, which I said at the beginning they were connected. So then he decided that I just needed to wait out the update that wouldn’t budge. 24 hours later it updated. Now I can’t get my device to stay connected to the speakers or a signal to actually play music.  But my speakers updated 3 times... maybe if I restart the app I can update the speakers again!  So glad we have this expensive giant electronic paperweight and useless app

I do admit it drove me crazy thinking it was the Bose speakers but I have a different wifi now with a better signal and haven’t had any of the speakers lose there signal  at all. Now as far as the sound of the speakers?  I have the whole set of soundtouch speakers and there all great sounding speakers. They aren’t cheap but if you want a quality sounding speaker , it’s Bose.

title: Sound Unparalleled Anywhere and Highly Connected
text: I needed to replace a set of speakers in my bedroom so having been a prior owner of a Wave Radio and two other Bose products I investigated the current offerings. I own a home that is Alexa connected so something SoundTouch related seemed logical. This system coupled with Alexa and the SoundTouch app meets all of my needs. The sound is simply outstanding!! I currently have several music services associated. Given the Alexa integration I can pretty much control most aspects of the system. Please continue working on providing additional functionality of the Alexa skill. My only “wish” would be support for “Calm Radio” music service.

Even if it just from one side to the other like iTunes. I know with new LCD/led tv burn in is nonexistent but some movement for "the just in case". Pressing up or down on an iPhone moves the volume 3-4 times. Same with the slide. Maybe a plus or minus. So if u start at 10 and want to go to 8, nope sorry you get 7 or go up from there you get 11. Just a little tweak!!!??

title: SoundTouch 130 should get 5 stars, if
text:
1. If the user manual is not as confusing.
It does never mentioned that the AUX HDMI input is audio only. 
2. The Optical, Coaxial, Analog and SIDE AUX inputs are very confusing. After I spent long time to find out that I have to set SIDE AUX to be audio input to accept Analog input. Analog Input is two RCA jacks labeled as R and L. If Bose updates the firmware to create one more selection for the SoundTouch/BlueTooth Button in the remote control, the problem is solved and I can use the SIDE AUX as head phone jack.

I like the design and the sound is terrifically great. The system is very versatile. I am using it for my TV and Karaoke and VCR together. There is nothing in the market come close to this quality. I will change the rating to definitively 5 stars after Bose corrected the two problems about.

title: Incomplete
text:
I love my Bose speakers. Great sound, great look. What I don’t love is the half-baked, incomplete app and firmware.

The app is glitchy. The volume control is not smooth. At times it reads quieter or louder than it actually is. Sometimes when you’re using it, it will suddenly take on a mind of its own and start increasing the volume without your permission. It will continue to do this, getting louder and louder unless you close the app and relaunch it. 

The speakers frequently (2-3x/week) become disconnected from the app and have to be reset by unplugging them. 

Lastly, the Soundlink feature for Bluetooth and Aux input playback creates a 3 second delay, making it impossible to use with any form of video. This was one of the big reasons we purchased these speakers rather than the Sonos, since we can theoretically use them when we watch a movie on the computer. We found a workaround that isn’t ideal as we lose the stereo effect, but it involves an aux cable splitter. 

All that to be said, it’s really confusing and disappointing that Bose would put out such great sounding speakers that are glitchy. It’s beneath the standard we’d expect from a brand like Bose.

title: So far, so great
text: Not only was the set-up very easy and the app very intuitive but the sound quality of the SoundTouch 30 is great. We've streamed pop, rock, R&B and country and the sound is crisp, clear and loud. The bass is excellent and can be adjusted to accommodate your taste. The app allows for simple streaming from Pandora,Amazon Music etc as well as a selection of playlists and radio stations associated with the app. The wi-fi set up was very simple and works flawlessly as does the Bluetooth option. We have a theater system in our basement and didn't want another complex, multi-component system and the sound touch was a perfect solution for our living room.

title: Great product
text: Bought the SoundTouch 300 along with the Acoustimass 300 subwoofer as a replacement for an existing Samsung sound bar and subwoofer. The sound is exceptionally clear. With the Samsung I found myself having to increase the volume to make out conversations or dialogue when watching TV. With the SoundTouch conversations/ dialogue is crisp and clear at lower volumes. Amazing! I also use the app to play music through the system. Of course music sound good through the SoundTouch but what's cool about it is that the system can be powered on from the app so I can be in any room in my house and through the app play and control my music! Very practical piece of equipment.

title: Works great
text: I live on a boat and have been shopping for a mini bookshelf stereo for sometime. All the mini stereos, Denon, Yahama, Sony, etc are all 3+ year old designs. If your lucky, they will dock an iPhone 4 and their Bluetooth is outdated science. I started looking at Bluetooth speakers but needed wifi radio. Crappy reception where I live. This speaker solved the problem of perpetually shopping thru expensive outdated stereo setups. I give it 5 stars and am happy as a clam! On a side note, I know good sound and ain't easy to please. Only downfall is no sleep timer which upsets quite a few folks. Works good and sounds good, that is if you like the Bose midrange sound. I might recommend also paring up a smaller tweety bluetooth speaker to bring in the full range.

title: Love my Bose system
text: Bought SoundTouch 10. 3 speakers. 3 different rooms. Able to operate all functions from iOS phone and iOS iPad and iMac. Very convenient. Some knowledge is needed to update each product when Bose does an update and when Apple does updates. Must reinstall Bose software from installer. All must be rebooted then. Took awhile for a 73 year old forever Apple user to get the updates working but if I candidates it anyone can. Or go to the help boards. The Boze help always gets me over the hump. Thanks for the support. I love my system. Bought it in1995. Still in love with it this may yesrs later❤️

title: Bose Soundbar / Bass Module / Surround Speakers Combination
text: Two weeks after purchase and setup, I am very pleased with SoundTouch 300 Soundbar, Bass Module 500, Surround Speakers on UFS-20 floorstands combination. Excellent sound for music and movies, versatile control via supplied remote and SoundTouch app on smartphone and tablet. Seamless transitions among TV, Wi-Fi and Bluetooth inputs. Physical design of components and system visual appearance are outstanding. Supplied installation documentation is very minimal and initially had difficulty connecting bass module. Web research and software update via the SoundTouch app required to enable connection. Once initially connected, the system has been operating flawlessly.  I highly recommend this product combination.

title: Loving it 16 yrs of sound!

Loving my outdoor system, It has not been flawless but that’s due to the age of my system 16 years of service flawlessly for 16yrs. My Lifestyle SA-2 amplifier failed any it was time for an upgrade.

Bose SoundTouch SA-5 Amplifier
works well with Alexa . I’m back in the sound business and it has been working well for the past 2yrs. If your inside listening to your bose musics then must get an out outside listening System. Folks enjoy!

title: Very slowly getting better
text:
I have had Bose Soundtouch SA-5 amplifier and Bose speakers for few years now. In the beginning, connection over wi-fi was very flaky. Over the years, after many updates and especially after AirPlay 2 update last year, connection has become a breeze. Now they have added feature “Stream custom radio url” which I really like. I do wish they can make this feature into “Radio Alarm with custom radio url”. 
And please make it possible so the speakers always turn on at a fixed preset low volume. Often times, the speakers come on at full blast volume and my family starts yelling at me full blast.

title: Bose does it again
text: I remember the first wave radios that Bose made , well they've come along way baby !! The sound touch lets you integrate all your mobile devices all your internet radio stations including pandora , Sirius xm , and so on and so on . I just received my SoundTouch and I've been experimenting with all its features so far it's a great addition to my home audio . The sound is very rich and the bass is fully adjustable which is something most Bluetooth wireless speakers don't have , but the soundtouch is much more than just  a speaker it's wifi equipped and when you download the free controller app it's very easy to set up and go .

title: Fake reviews
text: No way it’s at 4.7 stars when the reviews are clogged with complaints about the app. Doesn’t connect. Speaker constantly can’t be found even on the same network as my phone. I can set it up and it’ll find the network then as soon as setup is complete it’ll be lost again. It’s 2020. How is this even an issue. May i have a job at Bose please? I want to get paid to do nothing. Same interface for the longest period of time. What’s the point of providing feedback if nothing addressed gets improved? Only good thing about this purchase is that I bought the speaker on sale for $100. Not a big loss. Sound is good when it’s working. But the silence and solid light on WiFi is the best feature. Gives me time to meditate while the speaker shows its connected but the app says it isn’t.

title: I wish it were better
text:
I have five Bose devices and three iPods in my “Bose Ecosystem”.  The SoundTouch app should make everything work together smoothly, right?  That is not the case.  Sometimes, an iPod will never find a speaker, even if the speaker is in the same room and turned on.  When that happens, I have to delete then re-install the app on that iPod.  Wasted time.  The app itself is awkward and counterintuitive.  There must be a more efficient way to select a speaker than swiping through individual screens.  Maybe a different user interface would help.  

The concept of using an app to control all of the music throughout my house is great.  But the follow-through provided by the app is very weak.  I wish it were better.

title: SoundTouch app & WiFi speakers, 10, 20, 30.
text: We love the WiFi speaker sound superior, but the app doesn’t yet support Apple Music which is terrible thing for both Apple and Bose as well, it’s long overdue that both corporations get to to the table and whatever the issue holding up the agreement, be it for whatever reason, in today’s customer needs and wants it’s should be priority 1 for both companies and app engineers to realize this priority to make their customers want to give them a 5 stars rating across the board, please resolve this already, I’ve been asking and awaiting for at least a couple of years!

title: March 2020 update has made the app so much more stable and usable. Thank you!
text:
When the app works, it's really great. Sometimes freezes, which is frustrating. The Pandora pop up "are you still listening?" seems to be the main culprit.

Update: it has definitely gotten better. The Pandora issue has been resolved, and I’m working my way through the newest internet radio feature app. Not a wide selection of local stations, but that should improve with time. 

When it works, which is 95% of the time now, I love it. Troubleshooting the system still makes me nuts and I’m pretty good at troubleshooting.

title: App can’t find speaker
text: I love Bose products and my problem isn’t with the speaker itself, it’s with this app. It a daily occurrence that this app can not connect to the speaker. I will open up the app and nearly every-time and have to reconnect the speaker to my phone.  This can take about 5-10 minutes.  Once in while I can understand having to do this, but everyday/every time I open the app!  Not worth it. I have made a few complaints to Bose about this already but still nothing has changed in the nearly 3 years I’ve owned this speaker. I wish something would get done about it.

title: Great rural living solution!
text: We have WiFi so streaming music is enhanced. The free software and radio stations provide many new radio stations to explore.  The sound is what you would expect from Bose.  No surprises there.  This morning it snowed so the station had a bit static which surprised me.  Overall the setup was easy just keep in mind the sound machine reacts in slow motion.  Enter a command when setting up the first time and wait.  I got impatient and gave too many commands in to short of a time frame.  Sadly this made the initial setup take some time.  I just got it setup last night, so the jury is still out on how it fits into our lifestyles.  I’m excited to have the Bose in the house!

title: Very frustrating experience with the app
text: I had 2 SoundTouch 10 for a while now (about 3 years). Suddenly, one of them decided to disconnect from the network and until today I haven’t been able to reconnect it (this happened about 4 months ago). I’ve tried every way I found online to try to fix this and couldn’t make it work. I’ve read that the problem is with the iOS app, and when trying to connect the speaker the error message I get is “mobile device can’t find speaker on network”. The speaker works fine with Bluetooth but won’t reconnect to the WiFi network, which is the feature I use the most. So I pretty much stopped using the Bose speakers and seriously started to consider to just buy Sonos speakers which I understand that work great with iOS.

title: Connecting...
text: Like many have shared, the speakers are good but the app is subpar.  Constantly having to reconnect the system several times a week.  After 15 mins of reconfiguring the system, I no longer want to listen to the music anymore.  Otherwise the app is decent if there are no connection issues.  Once in a blue moon, the system will play randomly on its own. This is something the developers at Bose need to figure out.  I’m tempted to get rid of these speakers all together because I’m tired of messing with it.  However, I find that if I reset the system to factory settings every 2 months, hiccups in connectivity is lessened.

title: SoundTouch 300 with Acoustimass
text:
SoundTouch 300 unit is phenomenal in every aspect. It can be a bit confusing for certain Bluetooth hookups but essentially very straightforward. title: Bose sound touch is awesome
text: The Bose sound touch is awesome he picks up more Internet radio stations and I could ever imagine from talk to electric music or should I say from talk radio both a.m. FM shortwave and Internet and electric on music is awesome and I get so many choices I get probably over 10,000 different radio stations I hope they add more I get excellent radio receiving at a good price and it’s well worth the price I like to think it’s the people at bowls for an awesome Wi-Fi radio machine and I can play and I can play CDs was no problem people at bowls are very professional thank you for everything considerably yours JOHN R. PHILLIPS Bradford Pennsylvania

title: They now demand your location to use
text:
I bought the Bose SoundTouch IV and enjoy it. But now it stopped working if I want to control it through my iPad. After some looking I see it now insists on me giving it my geographical location via their app. I said no, and the app said sorry it can’t be set up now.  

To me it seems that they are deliberately withholding my access to the product, for the purpose for which I bought it, until I now allow them to geolocate me.  I can’t see how that is a technical requirement, it is forcing their way into my private life by disabling a product that I paid hundreds of dollars for until I give into their demands.  

I want to ask them, are you selling my location?  What technical need is driving this?  How do you financially benefit from this?

title: App needs some work
text: Just bought a SoundTouch 10 for the portability and sound quality. The speaker is great, but this app needs some serious work before I would consider adding more Bose speakers to my collection. Initial setup and Wi-Fi connectivity went well, easily figured out how to add my Pandora account, discover radio stations and program the preset buttons. The biggest problem is with this app staying connected to the speaker via Wi-Fi, and once it’s lost, having to go through the setup process all over again. Each time it occurs. 4 times in the less than 24 hours I’ve owned the product. I can move the speaker all over my house, it connects right up to the Wi-Fi and can play any of the preset channels without fail, but the app is unable to find it again without going through all the motions again.

title: Awesome
text: I love this app, because I love music.  I can find anything for any occasions.  I love a variety of music.  Motown Christmas Carrols today and Country Music Classics, Oldies, R&B, Jazz, Classical, and Hip Hop & Rap for the younger generation.  When I purchased my Bose a few years back, it has become my absolute favorite possession and I use this app to bring great sound and so much variety in my home.  Thanks for bringing such a wonderful app to all of us music lovers.  This wonderful sound touch app is easy to use with WiFi & blue tooth.  I am constantly expanding my music and find it extremely easy to create channels I love.  Merry Christmas & Thank You.

title: Bose Soundtouch
text: The Bose Soundtouch systems are superb.  Easy to use, auto updates happen easily, very accessible from any device...incorporates favorite buttons if you want to use, including favorite Pandora stations, internet radio, or attached devices.  Remote volume control, switch tunes on the fly, etc.  Just very well designed.  Have one at beach also, and over 6 years have called customer service a couple of times, who helped diagnose my own wireless issues...just incredibly helpful and patient.  Most impressed with product and company.

title: Much improved, but...
text:
This app has really improved over time and is very useful and practical. 
We have one gripe and this happens often: we use the app to setup the 4 speakers through out the house to sync, but when we reopen the app, the speakers are disconnected, they do not respond when adjusting the volume. We “kill” the app and after reopening it will work again. I looked at the settings, but did not find a setting I could change. Is this a bug that could be fixed, or can you tell what I need to do to make work all the time?
Thank for listening😉
John Kubler

title: Enjoy your hair now, you’ll be ripping it out soon
text:
This is the most infuriating app I have ever had to use. To start, I love my two bose WiFi speakers. I have a sound touch 10 and 20. Their sound is great and once connected to a network stream very well.

This app however, needs to be trashed and rebuilt. Ascetics, integration, and functionality all left me incredibly disappointed in my decision to purchase the bose sound touch system. The only time the app functions properly is connecting to a Bluetooth device. Outside of that, it constantly searches for my speakers and then says they can’t be found or that there is no WiFi connection. All while streaming crystal clear music that I have no control over which clearly means both my device and speakers are connected to the same network.

You can do better bose...

title: Been using Bose for 30 years...app driving me away
text: This is the most ridiculous and most convoluted way I’ve ever seen to sep up a freaking system. This app is seriously user unfriendly!  I’ve been a loyal Bose user for almost 30 years, but this app has me taking this piece of equipment back! I’m done with Bose! I have a 700 Sound Bar with Subwoofer, and was just trying to set up a new Wave SoundTouch as well. This app sends you in a mad viscous cycle that doesn’t seem to understand that I already have a stupid Bose account for the Sound Bar. It just insist that my email is already associated with a Bose account (Duh, ya think?!?) and says I can sign in to the SoundTouch account. I’m sooooo over this crap. Goodbye Bose, you make great equipment, but your convoluted setup has driven me to other manufacturers. Good riddance!

title: Forced “Update”
text:
Initially impressed with ease of use and set up. This week I was forced to install an update before I could use my SoundTouch product. Nice that you’re told upfront that the update will take 20 minutes!  Thought the estimate was high - it wasn’t. What could take 20 minutes to update for a speaker?  Apparently it takes that long to remove most everything that worked using WI-FI and Bluetooth because now all this app does is search for the speaker. 
Panasonic TV and Apple TV streaming unit which the SoundTouch is connected to make network connections in seconds. After almost 10 minutes SoundTouch still searching. 
The only saving grace is I can connect to Apple TV and stream music through ARC hardwire connection. Great sound but terrible wireless technology

title: Please allow speaker grouping
text:
Please implement a way to set up pre-defined “groups” of bose speakers. I have 16 bose SoundTouch speakers and right now I have manually set the ones I want to play every time after starting the music. I always play from the same groups. 

Additionally, the interface for choosing a speaker I want to play (ie scrolling between available speakers is clunky) is frustrating. When I open the app I should immediately see a list of all available 16 speakers and just be able to click the one I want. Right now if I want to play for example the hottub speakers I have to scroll all the way to the end of the list with my finger and it takes 20 seconds longer than it should.

title: Great Streaming Sound!
text:
I bought the SoundTouch just before I went into enforced isolation after a nuclear-medical procedure. My CD changer went out and replacing to was too difficult.  I wanted quality sound, access to a wide variety of music & radio and easy use.  SoundTouch20 promised all that.  I am extremely pleased. I considered a ST30, but really don't need the extra power b/c I now live in a townhouse so the 20 is powerful
enough.  I'm not a wizard with electronics or technology, and the ease of set up and use is perfect for me.  This was a GREAT purchase for me! —. Four years later: I still LOVE the ST20!  Still.

title: Taking mine back to store
text: Have had my ST300, with Aucoustamass and 3-ST10 speakers. It’s always a nightmare trying g to use it. Each time you try the speakers can’t be found. The app says it’s updating a speaker. Over and over. Now we have the TV surround and music playing at the same time no matter what you do. Yes on the same speaker not two different ones. Vender agreed and is allowing a 75% credit of the purchase price towards another system. I’m gladly jumping on this. I’d skip Bose for a while. We own 6 different items from Bose currently and are finding much better offerings of ease of use and quality elsewhere. We have two GMC trucks, QC35 we just traded in, an over ear wired set up, two in ear set ups and the ST300.  Also our second Bose outlet is getting ready to close.

title: Terrible software- constant problems resolved!
text:
Update- Victor was extremely helpful and persistent and stayed with us til issue was resolved- communication between speaker software and in-home Eero network needed configuration improvements- hopefully, we’re good to go now!!

Often with updates, the speakers are impossible or almost impossible to re-connect- this is repetitive and a huge inconvenience- right now, I have three of four that will not re-connect by Wireless, by USB or by Ethernet cable- getting them to connect to home wireless

It’s true what they say- Bose is a good speaker company with bad software and Sonos is a good software company with only adequate speakers- too bad Bose doesn’t understand that software is essential to leveraging their excellent speakers- next time I will buy Sonos- cannot deal anymore with the buggy software, constant disconnections, terrible user interface etc.......

title: Used to work great!!
text: So it looks like there was an update 3 days ago. That’s good to know because that’s exactly when this app stopped working.  It had its glitches over the past couple of years, but this is the worst. I’ve rebooted my iPad x6 with no luck. Then deleted the app and re-installed, now on the 3rd try at that. Still no luck. The app tries to open and it spins for hours and still nothing, a blank screen with the tiny little spinning circle, nothing more. Would love to experience the great sound of my Bose SoundTouch speakers again. Anybody have a suggestion that might solve this?

title: Usually great
text:
We started with one sound bar unit in our family room and soon added a IV in the kitchen.  Finally added a SA-5 with some 251's outside in our English garden and deck.  It is fantastic when we are entertaining and can have the same music at appropriate levels in all areas.  

We did add stereo volume controls to the 2 sets of speakers outside so they can be different (app doesn't allow that on one SA-5 unit).

About once a month the IV needs to be reconnected.  That is the only complaint.  Well, the price is a bit high but it does seem to be the best available now so I could either pay or go with a second rate product.

title: Serious fan of Bose.... but....
text:
True to Bose form, the speakers and processing are fantastic.  With everything moving toward cloud based music streaming, clearly it would make sense to focus on creating a top notch app.  Unfortunately, this is a Bose fail.  The app is clunky, and is constantly trying to find the Soundtouch speakers.  The app also crashes frequently.  It makes no sense to offer a product with wifi functionality, and then not follow through on producing a more functional system.  

Until Bose can work out the bugs, the app deserves no better than 2 stars.

Update:  latest version of the app is less buggy. However, still no native iTunes streaming.  Sonos wins on that front.

title: Updates needed
text: I couldn’t connect my Iphone 12 PRO-MAX after attempting to connect multiple times. It is very frustrating. As expensive as their products are, you would expect an app that would have an up to date firmware AND seamlessly connect to devices. The issues I was having was connecting with the “wifi” feature of the Soundtouch 30 via the app. When you completed the set-up and completed renaming it, it just goes back to square one and say “connection is not recognized” and would ask you to either retry or start over. I even started to ask myself if I was putting the correct wifi password. I just gave up after multiple tries. I don’t understand why people would rate the app with 5 stars.

title: Love the app
text:
I used to only connect with Bluetooth. The problem with that is Bluetooth drains your battery really fast. Since downloading the app I connect through wifi I can listen for 8 plus hours without charging my phone.

Also, controlling the volume and having all my music providers in one place is great. The only issue I have is I would love for the volume to work with the buttons for the phone volume. It can be inconvenient to have to unlock my phone or get out of another app to turn the volume down.

Overall I love the app!!

title: Many years use, same issues
text:
First off, app works fine, and is fairly user friendly. Only real option that I am aware of to link your Bose systems to each other. 

What would give it 5-stars? The ability to link audio from the home theater/TV system to non-visual speakers. I would love to be able to watch the game, walk into the kitchen, and still be able to hear what’s happening! 

Likewise I hooked my record player to the AUX connection, wish I could link this to my other speakers as well. Is there a better way I should be doing this?

title: Great listening pleasure
text: I use sound touch amplifier to connect all of the in-wall speakers at all three levels in my house. It has been a wonderful experience to turn it on everyday and listen to my favorite classical music stations and other music apps through sound touch. With software updates it has become a more and more reliable source of music for my house when having a party or just listening everyday. I would recommend sound touch all music lovers!

title: BOSE SOUNDTOUCH
text: amazing piece of wireless equipment, it makes my backyard so alive any day on any given time! Very appealing and guest appreciation is top notch. title: Sub par quality

Let me start off with this.... the sound quality is amazing.......however, the “internet radio” is terrible!

title: Networked 4 Speakers and Loving It
text: I have successfully networked my 4 SoundTouch speakers with both wired and wireless connections. I can stream iTunes via an Airport Express to the Aux connection and broadcast the music throughout the house. Earlier versions of the Sound Touch software were a bit confusing but the newer versions are much easier to use. I have worked with Bose support on a couple of connectivity issues that were solved.

title: From1968

title: Bose SoundTouch 300
text: I have the complete setup bass module and surrounds. With the latest software update it is without a doubt Bose best. 4 stars because it's still evolving. I'd like to see the app be able to totally replace the need to have the remote along side me during movies. As a Mac and IOS fan the Apple Bose experience is much improved. title: Needs SiriusXM improvement and Apple Music
text:
The Soundtouch app is wonderful and works great with my Bose speakers and Soundtouch wireless adapter.  The only reason that I am writing this review is that it needs some fixing and improvement.

Fixing:  When I first purchased a Soundtouch unit, this software use to show the metadata (song information) when playing a SiriusXM station.  It no longer does so.  Every other SiriusXM app/device displays the music info, but not Soundtouch.  This needs to be brought back.

Improvement:  Apple Music and iTunes Match music uploaded to  iCloud need to be added as a service.  I do know that Apple is highly proprietary, and they do have their own speaker/home device; maybe that is why they don’t contract with Bose.  But my feeling is that it could be a win/win situation for both companies and the customer.  I’ve held off subscribing to Apple Music for this very reason.  If it is added, I am going to subscribe to Apple Music.

Bose and Apple and SiriusXM have great products!  But please make these improvements.

title: Fantastic sound system
text: I’ve had my 300 sound bar with base unit for over a year now, and I can say that this is really a very nice sound system. In fact, I am so satisfied that I purchased a second system for our game room. It is pricey compared to all other sound bars out there, but you won’t regret the cost. The sound quality is so rich and the sound is so clear that it lets you enjoy your music and movies a lot more. It is also nice to be able to control its sound source with the app over WiFi and Bluetooth.

title: Very happy w Sound Touch!
text:
I started off with two of the S 10 and then I went to get more I ended up getting the 30 and had to finish off with 20! The sound quality throughout the house is just excellent and I love the flexibility with individual volumes!  Only thing I am missing is the sound bar.... only enhancement I would like to see is the ability for a timer to automatically turn off or on....

Thank you Bose, for an excellent product and for the ability of these units to change as technology changes!

title: Updates have made app terrible
text: The updates made to this app over the past few years have made it difficult to control speakers. It has a hard time connecting to my devices. It won't let me skip songs in pandora AT ALL even when I just turned it on. Navigating between two speakers is cumbersome. Oftentimes i can't link the two speakers together because it can't seem to find one.
