Of late, I thought the issue I was experiencing was due to needing to upgrade but there isn't an upgrade out there.

title: Great sound!!! Happy with the purchase!!!
text:
This was a great choice. The sound is really good, what is to be expected from Bose, but I have to say, I like everything about this speaker. 
The  Sound touch app is really good 
The blue tooth connection is really good as well, and the internet connection is premium! 
Highly recommend if you need a good speaker for your living room. I have to say that I strongly consider B&W speaker, but the price really made a big difference here. 
I don't think anybody can go wrong here, Bose is a great American company that will make you happy with this product.

title: New user 1-week
text: Since getting my new Bose portable speaker I have found many new stations; in our Area we only have six channels most of it garbage. So when I hooked up sound touch I actually love it I'm listening to music from all over the United States the Bahamas Jamaica the Caribbean wow I couldn't be more ecstatic about this. And I can move this little speaker in any room, get yourself hooked too!! The Bluetooth works awesome I can move my phone anywhere in the house and it still works thanks guys for such a great app🤗👍. I even use speaker outside ❤️!

title: Nice Speakers but TERRIBLE app
text: So...I am on year 2 of this system. For the price you pay, why can't BOSE spend some money and design a better app!!!??? I am constantly trouble shooting it trying to get it to recognize my different devices. I think if you are using one device it is ok but with more than one, it confuses the system. title: awesome
text:
We went from a bluetooth link from a dedicated laptop in our kitchen to this, the sound is superb. The fidelity is far superior to our bluetooth set up

Last no more jumping up to see who the artist is, we just reach for our phone or look at our laptops
The only downside is that we now have a new empty spot to collect clutter

title: Thank you Bose
text:
Every time I turn on my Bose noise reduction headphones after boarding a flight I am reminded of the quality I purchased. My impression of Bose has only grown in stature as I have had the privilege of upgrading my home to the SoundTouch system. I started with the sound bar 300 for home theatre, added the wireless base, then the satellite speakers, then a kitchen (soundtouch 20) and gallery (soundtouch 10) speakers. The setup has been flawless, compatibility with more than one controller is amazing. All-in-all I can’t be more impressed. Worth every penny. 
Thank you Bose!

title: Good... when it works.
text:
We’ve had our Bose Speaker now for better part of 2 years.  Great promises but short on delivery.   Most of the time the App says it can’t find the speaker.  Before anyone says “well move it closer to the router”, I’ve done that.  Nothing changes.  One day will work great then next day can’t connect.   When it connects it is wonderful, you just can’t count on it.  We had a party and low and behold it would not connect for us to stream music.  Sadly enough my Ryobi Wi-Fi speaker was there to rescue us from uncomfortable silence.  Lol.  

Maybe the tech has changed maybe not.  We have the latest software version and still crappy connection.  For the money I would buy something else.

title: Roll of the dice every time I use it
text: Unreliable. I use this for a SoundTouch 10 speaker, and I never know if it's going to work. Sometimes it does, but just as often it doesn't. Adding to the frustration is the fact that this app is updated ridiculously too often. And every time that happens, I have to go to my computer to update that end of it, then, of course, update the iPhone app. All of which means spending 10 minutes doing all that before I can start to listen to music. Kind of a buzz kill. And seriously, Bose, what needs to be updated so freaking often?  But I want to emphasize that, separate from the job-justifying updates from Bose's engineers, the app sometimes just simply doesn't work. No rhyme or reason. But plenty of frustration.

title: Crashed and cannot download any longer
text:
I was in the middle of using the app with my speakers and it just closed on its own. I tried everything included deleting the app and reinstalling it but it won’t even get past the white screen with the hour glass spinning for hours. I restarted my iPad 3 times also. The app said there was an update at the time it crashed but I never even tried to do it. My iPad also updated since this to 14. I can no longer use the app to listen to music and I’m not sure what to do.
Any help is welcomed.

title: Will not stay connected to Wifi!
text:
I only get one day of connection to my Wifi network usually, then I must go through the whole "find my speaker" process through the app and reconnect it to Wifi again. And it is made more cumbersome with all the, try many times to complete, remote button pushing, because the Bose network does not show up on my IPhone 8+, with all the software up to date.  I keep hoping this will change. It has done this for the last year without improvement! Works great after I spend 5 to 10 minutes onre-establishing the Bose Network and connecting the app again. 
This bug won't go away!

title: Worst Clunky App ever
text:
The hardware is great and sound quality excellent. The original software that operated the system worked well however after one “upgrade “ it basically quit working. I literally delete and reinstall the app several times a month and have to restart my WiFi modem several times a week. Ridiculous! When I bought the system I convinced a few friends to get them, now I absolutely regret the fact that they took my advice. 

It seems that if Bose would simply put some effort into fixing a software issue they would have one of, if not the best total home entertainment options on the market. Instead I’m writing this review because I can’t listen to any music.

title: Getting better 😊
text: I’ve had bose SoundTouch speakers for about 3 years.  Often, once or twice per week, the app couldn’t find my speakers, even after playing music on them for an hour. It would just quit, and then suddenly can’t find the speakers. I’ve contemplated selling them, just to rid myself of the frustration. But, I’m lazy, and never did. I’m noticing lately that the “lost speaker” phenomenon has pretty much stopped. So, I like them again, and probably won’t sell them (even though my laziness would prevent that anyway).

title: Review
text:
The remote is annoying. I can’t pick it up and know which way I’m holding it. I have to look at it so I point the front end forward. It would be nice if there was some contour in at and the keys were lit so you can see in the dark. The layout of the keys is not that great either. 
It seems to sound good at least. I def like it much better than the sonos one I ended up returning since I had to play all my music through their app. Very annoying. Thank you for letting me just stream my phone content to the speaker through iTunes or whatever app I want to use. 
I’m curious how much better it will sound if/when I get the base cube.

title: Clunky and Unreliable
text: I’ve always loved the sound of Bose speakers and so I bought 4 of them and linked them together using this app.  Everything works as it should except when it doesn’t...which is often.  There has to be a better solution.  I’ve spent far too much time trying to get the app to locate and stay connected to my speakers - and yes, I have excellent WiFi coverage - it’s just a buggy system and I’ve wrestled with it long enough!

title: Searching
text: If you’re thinking about installing this app it’s probably too late to recommend you not purchase Bose speakers.  The speaker sound is good but the integration of the the speakers with the app and your home WiFi network is unacceptable.  You will spend more time reconnecting and reinstalling that you will listening to music.  The tech support for SoundTouch appears to be located in Britain and the help is good but the issues they help solve are all related to terrible software that should be fixed long before it’s sent to consumers.  Further adding insult is the premium price Bose charges.  The product should be much less riddled with problems at this price.

title: Older tech is sometimes better
text: A web page connection “like a router uses” to the speakers to set them up on the network would be so much easier.  I get the ability to stream music over all the speakers and an app is needed for that.  Loosing connection between the app and speakers is so frustrating though.  The speakers are connected , the app is connected, yet you have to reset the devices connection.  So bad... but it’s all the consumers are offered to use by Bose.  Sonos is looking better and better!

title: Poor Poor Product
text: The Bose speakers are still by far a superior product.  The Soundtouch app on the other hand is one of the most unstable and poorest apps I’ve ever used.  The continual reconnection that needs to be done, when none of my other WiFi products need it speak to the lack of attention to detail in their app.  The last straw for me is the fact that after repeated deleting and downloading of app because all it was doing was the spinning wheel, there’s still no fix.  Shame on Bose for the amount of money spend on their product.  Again, speakers are awesome when working.

title: Sound touch 20
text: We love our new Sound Touch 20. The sound is great and it's so easy to use. Love having access to such a huge selection of music. I have one each of the Bose 10,20,&30 speakers and love all three. I put the 10 in our workout room, the 20 in our cottage and because we liked that so much I just purchased the 30 for our family room in our home. They all have great sound and I like that I can wirelessly sync my 10&30 together because there in our home so it's rock and roll throughout the house.

title: Multi speaker non functioning as usual
text: Apparently this app and the speakers it controls is great...if you only want to use one speaker at a time. I have three Bose 10 speakers and they have not played together in months. title: Sound great.  Constant connection issues
text:
I ha e 7 of these in my house including the 30 and 20 the rest 10’s. I’m going to have to be on drugs to live through the connection issues. Also I’ve had them for three years. Every time I turn around there is an update which screws everything up……

title: Utilizing WIFI is the key to flexibility.
text:
Using SoundTouch, I normally play music throughout the entire house when I am cleaning or home alone and moving around. And that includes the garage.

There was a time that the functionality stopped working. I emailed customer support a few times and they responded immediately. Although what they suggested didn’t work, they requested that I contact customer support who logged into my Wi-Fi network and fixed the problem. So I give 5 stars to customer support as well.

title: Always losing connection to speakers
text: I have multiple Bose systems throughout the house including attached to my main TV.  My music is on almost 24/7.  I work from home 80% of the week.   The app is horrible.  It disconnects from the speakers pretty much every day.  I close it down and re open several times a week.   I find myself having to walk over to my speakers to turn them on manually instead of using the app.   When it’s working well I stream all my music together throughout the house using the app.  That was my ultimate goal but unfortunately I can only get that on average once or twice a week.

title: Updating Apps
text: These app’s from Bose are always needing to be updated. Every time I update they never seem to run smooth. This is the only company I have this problem with. I like your products, but, I’m hesitant about buying more for this reason. Your latest update is the worst. I’m unable to download it it keeps bouncing me back and forth from the App Store page and need to update page . I would appreciate any help to resolve this problem. Thank you . Tee Cee

title: Great fun but spotty coverage
text:
We bought 3 Soundtouch10 to spread around the house.  Setup was pretty straightforward. At first they worked really well.  We were like "how did we live without music bumping all throughout the house?! But as the days went on we started to notice many times the speaker couldn't be found over wifi or or would start playing but just cut out.  Wifi isn't near as strong towards the back of the house which is probably the issue so I'm hoping a wifi extender/booster will
Solve the issue but until then it's highly annoying.

title: Totally awesome
text: I have Bose SoundTouch throughout the entire house. Initially I had some difficulties keeping all the speakers connected to my network. A change to a better WiFi modem and absolutely no problem. (It actually is the upgraded WiFi that Comcast offers, easy to install and these speakers have never not connected with that modem.)  Love this product, I can control volume, music, speakers from my phone or Alexa!  You won’t be disappointed!

title: Needs lots of work
text: This app is bulky, slow, limited, primitive and not very intuitive. Sorry Bose you know I love you or I wouldn’t be running 3 amps and 10 of your outdoor speakers. But! I also run SONOS in a few properties.  SoundTouch is light years away from the SONOS app. The function and user interface is something your developers need to take a close look at.  It seems your approach is less is more and that’s not the case with audio, multi-room setups and adjustability. No EQ! Really? The only option is to reduce the bass. I don’t think even my grandparents could appreciate your app. Until things change I’m putting you in Time Out! No more Bose purchases until your app behavior changes.

title: Great progress
text:
I’ve been slowly building my SoundTouch system for a number of years now, and I appreciate the progress on multi-room stability and with app usability. 

Feature Request:  instead of (or maybe in addition to would be easier for developers) swapping through speakers, one at a time, with no control of ordering them, could there be a list view of ‘my speakers’ with sort options including manual?  It could then click through to the existing interface. 

I have 7 now, and it’s getting clunky with regular use.

title: Difficult setup
text:
I love Bose speakers and have had them on my home theater system for years. I’ve had these two soundtouch 10 speakers for about a year or more. The sound is great, but the setup process is horrible. Connecting to Wi-Fi takes a LOT of patience. First it will ask for the Bose Wi-Fi network then it will not find my router network. I will have to toggle back and forth a few times until it finally connects. It’s just frustrating. But, when I finally do get it all set up, it sounds great!

The bad thing is that I have the windows version set up on my desktop and it works flawlessly! Bose needs to step up their game because this is just frustrating let alone somewhat useless. I dropped my star rating down to one 😠!

title: Great but needs improvement
text: Quality of sound is good but turning the thing on when not connected to power is one of the most torturous things I've ever done in the 21st century. Most gadgets this century don't take this long to turn on. Syncing with the Wi-Fi is another anathema. It doesn't always stay connecteded, and when it is time to reconnect, you spend like an hour trying to get it to connect. Wastes way too much time. For an expensive premium product like this, you shouldn't have to wait so long for basic tasks like powering on or syncing to wifi.

title: Doesn’t list all local radio stations
text: I love my local radio station - which streams online - and its not listed in the app. I’ve tried to contact Bose and I get no response. I can’t understand why they won’t add it to their app. If they do, I can add it to a preset button which is easier than Bluetoothing through my phone to the speaker. So until they reply to my online repeated requests (poor customer service Bose!) and update their local radio listings, they only get 2 stars from me.

title: Disappointing
text: Had these speakers for almost 2 years and I’ve really liked them up until the past 8 months or so. They can’t stay connected and I keep having to reconnect them to my network almost daily, and that process is painfully unreliable. They sound great but all the features my wife and I enjoy are buggy and frustrating to the point of me wanting to give up on the Bose brand for not being able to figure this out... after the latest update the app won’t even load on my iPad even after uninstalling, restarting the iPad and reinstalling app... disappointing. From the feedback I see I’m not the only one with these kinds of issues...

title: Give Us A Minute To Find Your Speaker...
text: “Give Us A Minute To Find Your Speaker...” & “Hmmm I can’t seem to find your speaker. Get used to those two phrases because that’s how you’ll spend 80% of your time dealing with this system. I’m beyond disappointed with this purchase. The sound, of course, is fantastic...when it works, which is rarely. I’ve never once opened the app, hit play and gotten music. I’ve eventually figured out a series of steps where I can make it work bit it always takes me 5 minutes to get it going and I’ve tried to have 3 dinner parties where it just flat out didn’t work. Bose should be ashamed of this offering because it’s NOT up to their standards.

title: Worst smart companion app I've used
text: Updates take hours. Connections get lost all the time. Volume sometimes doesn't change when you tell it to. Sometimes the app can't find the speakers. Sometimes you can sync music between multiple speakers, sometimes you can't. Sometimes you have to reset all devices from scratch for the app to find them. I have never successfully been able to play music throughout my house spur of the moment. If I'm going to have a party where I'll have music playing, I have to reset everything a couple hours before people arrive because it never "just works". Overall terrible and I regret buying Bose speakers instead of Sonos.

title: Constant Drops
text: I’ve purchased 6 SoundTouch units and have them placed all throughout my house. I’ve had them for a year + and been reluctant to write a bad review because I spend my professional life responding to bad reviews and find that MOST bad reviews are due to a customer not being smart or patient or understanding or all of those things. This is the first negative review I’ve ever written (no lie) Bose has FAILED on this one. The connection drops whenever you connect more than 2 units together. *picture it, hosting an epic party with over $10k of amazing sound equipment rocking the house, then. The music drops (not the beat shorty) the MUSIC - party over. I suggest Yamaha or going DTS. Bose... very dissatisfied and disappointed.

title: Constantly looses connection
text:
Too often when updates are needed the speakers keep pausing as if there is a problem with the Bluetooth connection or WiFi to my phone (both of which are NOT the problems). Then when updating it software cannot “find” speakers and I have to manually reconnect them and they cannot even connect to WiFi during that process. It is all on the speakers as everything else in the house works great. 
If they would consistently work and not need constant updates they are great. But I have no faith when I want to listen to music they will work all the time.

title: Don’t lose your remote, the app is worthless for switching back to TV
text:
The title pretty much says it all. If you go into the remote app you can easily switch to Bluetooth or their radios. However,If you happen to lose your remote you’re stuck. There’s no way in the app to switch back and this problem is been in the system since 2017. It doesn’t take much effort with Google to find the issue is systemic in many of the Bose systems.

I find it ridiculous to buy a two or $3000 for a Sound system which, still requires old-school methods,all the time, when one of the features they promote is the app and it’s ability to interact with the system itself.

title: When it Matters
text: Sound Touch, in my opinion has always been a bitter sweet experience; which is the way I like most things... When it works, it’s an enjoyable experience... then the occasional anomaly; you have to put on your troubleshooting hat; sometimes it takes an hour, sometimes not.  But, once the system is up and able to find all speakers and decides to do its thing, it’s an experience worth sharing with your bed friends or neighbors.  Four solid stars for Sound Touch!

title: Almost great
text: The app is quick to load and functionality is easy. The interface for most streaming services is great but loading off home computer is clunky and awkward.  Saving playlists and expanding functionality there would be much better.  It's the only thing I miss from sonos.  I would also love the ability to see what songs I've played on pandora.  If I like a song I'm hearing but don't get to the app in time I can't find out who or what it was

title: Bose has lost their way
text:
I bought a L1 Line array for gigs and the SoundTouch wireless to go with it for between sets. Never could get this app to work. I can connect to the device with Bluetooth then its WiFi when it instructed ... then. Please wait. I believe it’s trying to go to its server and download something but since it is connected to its WiFi there’s no internet connection. Although my phone has one.  When i am just starting the app fresh with my cell service it says cannot connect to bose server. 
I can however use the device connected to Bluetooth and play music. But that’s it and I already had a much cheaper device to do that so the Bose was a waste and this app doesn’t work. At least for me.

title: Too Many Updates
text: If you use the app on a regular basis, I guess it would work fine. Myself, I only need the app once a month or so to change a selected saved station or listen to something new.  When I do attempt to use the app it needs to update first. Which takes several minutes. And why it is always updating I have no idea. It’s not like they are adding new music apps. Also, after the update it says it cannot find my Bose unit.  It then wants you to go through the whole procedure of reconnecting to the WiFi even though I’m on the WiFi listening to music. I found the best step to do is close down the app reopen app and most times it will connect to the Bose unit then. Frustrating!

title: Used To Be Excellent
text: This app used to be excellent.  Now, since the last update to, supposedly, fix some bugs and issues, it doesn’t stay connected to the internet longer than a few minutes.  All other items connected to my network have no issues what do ever.  This is now a terrible app unless you want to hear your whole house speaker set up for 5 minutes or less.

title: Almost bought Sonos
text:
Soooo glad I did NOT but the Sonos system. I have the SoundTouch 300 sound Bar the soundtouch 30 and the sound wave    I can listen to them individually or all at the same time with the same song playing with amazing clarity out of them all.   By the way if you e never heard a Sonos speaker, well....... your not missing much ..... except an extremely over priced speaker (no matter which you choose) and a horribly listening experience. 

Love the vise and love the Soundtouch app

title: Finally an app that works
text: We have the 2 SoundTouch speakers for 4 years. Every time we’d try to use them the app could never find the 2 together. Also, every time there would be an update to install. They never worked right. Finally, in the last 3 months you have gotten the app to work. I can now play from Pandora and link the two speakers in two different rooms. What we got these for to begin with!! Yay for Bose!! Please don’t change a thing!

title: Used to Love this!  Not Anymore...
text:
I've always been a fan of this Bose sound, but being able to hear my music either by Bluetooth or direct from my Mac plus get Sirius and Internet radio on one easy app is great.

That was in August.  Now it’s December, and since the recent update, the app (iPad and iPhone) no longer works well with Sirius.  I get intermittent connections to some stations, presets work intermittently, rebooting, checking for updates, reconnecting - nothing makes this work as well as it used to. Even the presets on the remote are haywire.  The only way to hear Sirius radio reliably on my SoundTouch IV is to Bluetooth it from the Sirius app on my phone.  FIX THIS!

title: Very disappointed
text: I brought the speaker years ago and had this app downloaded, I always update it. Now I cannot even sign in to my own account. Apparently my daughter downloaded the app also and open an account. I cannot sign her out, I try signing into my account and it’s not allowing me to do so this is a stupid app if the device it can’t recognize a multi user. This need work as we live in a very Gadget Oriented time. Alexa allows multiple users.

title: Wave SoundTouch
text: I was always skeptical about the claims made in the Bose commercials, saying that this little device sounds like a big stereo system. After talking to people who had purchased one I decided to buy one still thinking there is no way it’s going to be as good as they claim . Wow was I ever wrong, this thing is amazing! The sound this thing puts out is unbelievable, I still am amazed when I listen to it ! It is without a doubt one of the best purchases I’ve ever made !

title: Love the speakers. The App has issues.
text: I love the fact that all of my speakers in the house are connected (including my home theater system) the speakers sound amazing! The app consistently has issues though. Sometime I have to close the app several times to get speakers to show up. Sometimes the volume consistently increases even while trying to turn it down or vice versa. It has been an ongoing issue. I wish they could fix the issue. (I have google home WiFi with several transmitters throughout my house)

title: Great next gen Bose product
text: I grew up around bose cd player-radio combos.  We were looking to replace a battery powered, blue tooth style device.  We finally settled on the sound touch due to the superior sound quality over battery powered devices.  It is a bonus that this product can be accessed via bluetooth connection and an ap.  The versatility makes the process of putting on music or a podacst less limiting. Sometimes apps require more fiddling than seems necessary.

title: The app is waste.
text: Purchased this last night, I’ve been 2 hours trying to get the app to work, it just doesn’t work at all. (“Hmm there was a problem checking for the update”) every time I try to play something from the app. Bluetooth seems to work fine, but the app seems like a complete waste, which to what I’ve seen so far, makes the buttons on the device useless. Will give it a couple of hours, if I don’t get it to work I am getting my money back. It’s not a cheap toy. Sound is as expected, but the system just doesn’t work as advertised. From what I’ve seen this is a common issue, and I won’t wait for Bose to fix it. It is going back to where it came from.

title: Better - not perfect
text: I’ve had my Bose SoundTouch speaker for several years now, and, I must say - the app has come A LONG WAY! So much so, that I was willing to invest in a secondary speaker to enjoy the experience throughout my house. The only deficit...is that to play the ENDLESS SEA of music on my phone/Apple Music...I have to use AirPlay...which works, but hiccups often, and sometimes stops playing on its own altogether. Overall, I’m happy with the improvements over the years, and very much look forward to continued progress with the SoundTouch app.

title: Great sound, but can test your patience
text: Let me say upfront this unit produces a rich quality sound. I especially like the preset capability. The challenge I’ve had is randomly disconnecting from my Wi-Fi network even though that network did not change names or passwords. When that happens, you have to go through and reconfigure the unit. This is time consuming and frustrating. But once it is stabilized it keeps working for months. It’s a welcome addition to our home.

title: Mostly Great
text: Sometimes drops. Sometimes drops, then picks right back up. Is not compatible with my 5.0 Wi-Fi band, but only with the 2.4, even though the devices are fairly new-why cannot they be made compatible by some sort of an update? But mostly I love how it works from the app on my various devices and I would much rather listen to Bose speakers then echo or Alexa or any other kind of home system. And I like that I can choose to play just my wi-Fi wave radio or can join in my SoundTouch speaker and they play together seamlessly!

title: Can’t Find >$1000 Worth Of Bose Speakers In Mesh Router System
text: Without a doubt this is the most frustrating app on my iPhone!  We have a top-of-the-line mesh router system that works perfectly with everything except this app.  Sometimes the app can find our several Bose speakers, but, >90% of the time it can’t!  Is it the router system?  No!  Because my PC is hard-wired to the router and the Bose app on it ALWAYS finds the speakers.  I called Bose support some months ago and the surly guy on the support line demanded we do a remote session, he logged in to the router, and then refused to describe what he was doing.  What he did worked until the next time I tried to use the app on my iPhone.  Love my Bose speakers - HATE this iPhone app!

title: Sound bar 300
text: The sound quality on this product is excellent. No complaints on that end. Also the bar itself is very attractive and compliments my entertainment system. The only complaint I have is that I wish I can see the system settings on the tv instead of having to do everything on the app. Overall very satisfied with this product.

title: Improved Performance
text:
I am using SoundTouch for the past 5 years. At the beginning it was the most buggiest App, that I have come across.

Last few months, I see a marked improvement in terms of s/w updates, better Bluetooth connectivity. The speaker suddenly used to disappear and it was hard to reconnect- each time we need to go through the setup. This issue seemed to be addressed.

Thanks

title: Took me a minute to figure out how to add a new speaker.
text: I had one SoundTouch and was adding another one. I missed something during pairing of the second one and than couldn’t pair the second one. So had to unplug the first speaker that was previously setup. And after loosing that one out range I managed to setup the second speaker. Than I plugged the first one and managed to pair it all together to enjoy the True SoundTouch experience. Quality is excellent as expected.

title: Sporadic at best
text: When the speakers connect the sound is unbeatable. 9 times out of 10 they don’t. App says “searching” forever, then “cannot find”. During reboot you’re supposed to connect to a Bose... WiFi ID but it is never there in the list. This is so frustrating, especially having spent so much. All the rest of my WiFi devices have no problem. The Bose equipment is so unreliable I have come to rely on my Echo devices. Sorry, just conveying the truth. Just saw an update to all the Bose speakers. Let’s see if that makes a difference.

title: SoundTouch delivers!
text: Control of multiple speakers, multiple sources all in an easy to use app.   The app facilitates control from multiple devices allowing increased flexibility, while multiple source control provides added ability to tailor your music from anywhere from separate sources seamlessly.   Using the SoundTouch Link further allows existing and legacy equipment to add streaming and music library sharing across your home wireless network.  Well done BOSE!

title: Overall a good sound system for the money
text: Overall I very satisfied with this system. I have the SoundTouch  30 in my bedroom and the 10 in my bathroom. I very much like connecting them so that the music is the same in both rooms. While I wouldn't be happy using them as my primary sound system they give excellent sound for smaller rooms. Connecting them to my wifi and with each other was a bit cumbersome but not difficult.

title: Doesn't work anymore
text:
ENot sure what happened but my bose 10 no longer pairs and this app is horribly frustrating to work with

Update- how much is Bose paying people to leave positive reviews now? My device worked fine before this app on Bluetooth, now the Bluetooth doesn't seem to work and I seem dependent on an app that frequently disconnects or becomes buggy. Will likely not look to Bose for any devices that rely on wireless connectivity from this point on

Update August 2017 - still plagued by connectivity issues. Currently stuck in a state of "updating" and can't use the speaker. I've given up and I'm going to sell my speaker and have it be someone else's problem

title: This could be a good system...
text: There have been several times where my speakers don’t work or synch and require me to reinstall them. Annoying. The MOST annoying part is that very often when you open the app there is a forced update that takes twenty minutes that you are REQUIRED to do before you can use the app. So if you just want to play some music you have to wait till all your speakers are updated (20 minutes) till you can use them. It happens all the time. I wish I had chosen a different system that worked more consistently.

title: Infuriating. Glitchy. Not what I expected from Bose.
text: App just will not stay connected to the speakers. Constantly searching & searching, finally getting the “Hmmmm...” error. I have been fiddling with this system since January 2017 and I so regret ever purchasing it. Several episodes a day where I have to stop what I’m doing and tinker with this thing for 20 minutes - Restarting the app, trying to add speakers, running around turning speakers on & off (all 8 of them) to get the app on my phone to “find” them - let’s try the iPad - ok maybe the other tablet will work. etc. Awful. Shame on you, Bose - from a loyal 40 year customer who expected better from your brand. Please fix this app!!!

title: Terry N.
text: I have owned a SoundTouch Wave for a couple of years and absolutely love it. I recently bought a Klipsch rbs-14 sound bar but have had nothing but trouble keeping it linked to my streaming sources. Two weeks ago I bought a Bose wireless speaker extender and connected it to the Klipsch. Problem solved!  I can now play both devices in unison or separately without dropping off line. Really solid set up that is linked to my echo dot for voice control. Bose equipment just WORKS!  I love it.

title: App not working for months
text: This app has always been finicky. For the last little bit I can’t get deezer to work, none of my preset playlists work. I’ve reconnected the sound touch to my Wi-Fi many times because it can’t find my speaker after I try to get into deezer. The preset for tune in radio works just fine. But again I can’t seem to keep the app working over Wi-Fi and especially when trying to use deezer. This is a recent issue and has nothing to do with my home network. As a sidenote when you hit app help on the App Store, the website that it takes you to doesn’t even work. Very disappointing for Bose.

title: More disappointment
text: It seems no matter how many times you update this useless app, and how many times I go through the rigamarole of setting the speaker up with the router again, the app will be “Unable to find your speaker.”  If I use the remote and change the source to the network, it will immediately begin playing internet radio.  But the app will never find the speaker even though both are online to the same router. This is the last Bose product I ever buy.

title: Never boring!
text:
When I first installed my Bose system it took days to finally make it work. Over time I learned what’s working and what does not. 
Sound Touch is erratic. Sometimes it connects and sometimes I have to restart the system from scratch. 
When switching to TV sound is out of sync. Need to restart Netflix to get it right. There is always a surprise.

As always, I do like the BOSE sound definitely my favorite. I wish Bose would have as good digital/computer app engineers as they have sound engineers.

title: Tons of glitches
text: I have to sound touch speakers. I’ve had them now for four years. They consistently drop off of the Wi-Fi and have to be manually reset at least 2 to 3 times per day. This is terribly inconvenient in the middle of a party.  These speakers are constantly trying to update so I know it’s not an issue with updating. But in reality if the speaker works in 2015 why would it not work now? Regardless I’m very disappointed at the level of difficulty keeping my speakers connected to the Wi-Fi. Our router is only 5 feet away from each speaker. And we have used multiple routers in the past and I’ve had the exact same experience with each of them.

title: Great sound, decent app, needs more
text:
First Bose purchase and the sound is out of this world. The app has been extremely easy to setup and configure but they need to keep expanding the libraries / music services that we have access to in order to stay relevant. 

It seems like they’ve continued to pick up the pace of updates and enhancements... adding new streaming services etc.  Wondering where they’ll go on the voice recognition front a la Siri or Alexa... hint, hint,

title: Won’t stay connected
text: As a software interface for one of the most expensive hardware setups out there, this thing is terrible. It almost never connects on the first try, and usually not the second or third. I don’t understand why that’s splice a difficult thing to master. It’s also lame that you can’t adjust the bass in the app, instead you have to use the remote. The look of the app is nice, but I find the cluttered pages that minimize at the bottom distracting and confusing at times. It’s really a shame because the speakers are amazing but using this app makes the experience less than desired.

title: It makes using SoundTouch devices many times easier.
text:
I’ve been using the SoundTouch app for I’m gonna say roughly six months now and I can’t recommend it enough. I currently use it one the Wave SoundTouch Music System(which is amazing in its ownself)

Breaking it down the SoundTouch app does pretty much everything your remote does on your phone. You can turn it off and on, adjust the volume, turn on Bluetooth and set one of the many music stations.

title: Make this app accessible!!!😤🙄🙄
text: I use iPhone voiceover accessibility feature, first Bose you rarely update your apps and when you do nothing seems fixed. it is very difficult because this app is not user-friendly at all and makes it difficult toSet up speakers independently instead of looking for help when not needed  why don’t you fix this issue to work properly and not freeze up all the time and have to close and reopen thisapp… I didn’t want to leave a bad review but I called Apple about this and they said it is the app developer not the phone because the app developer didn’t make the compatible app

title: Disappointed
text:
I don't care for the UI of the app.  It is buggy and laggy and the sound touch speakers (10 and 20) always seem to have connectivity issues and Bose seems to have some privacy issues, requiring that you enable Location Services in order to use the (very expensive) speakers. This would have been a non-starter for me if they had disclosed this at purchase, which they should be required to do for any contingencies of use. WTH do they need to know my location for, just another company overstepping it’s bounds. 

Sound quality of speakers is okay.

title: Will not complete updating which makes it useless
text:
I got this for my husband for Christmas. What a huge disappointment. The app goes to the update screen and stays on 0% progress. Since it will not complete updating, it leaves the speaker as just another simple Bluetooth speaker. I can’t connect it to Alexa, SiriusXM, or even another Bluetooth speaker. So all I can do with it is connect via Bluetooth to one device and use it alone with no other speakers. 

I wanted to use it with my SiriusXM account and control it with Alexa. I wanted to places other Bluetooth speakers throughout the house. The guy at the Bose store assured me I could do all of this. Well none of that works. 

I will be returning it.

title: Disappointed
text: Have really enjoyed my Bose Wave SoundTouch. Thought it would be great to add SoundTouch 10 speaker. They both work independently, but do not play together. The other one says it’s playing what it should but no sound. Try to look up that situation/question in the Bose Community forum questions and help topics. Low and behold there WERE  questions there with that SAME problem listed in 2016, but NO answers/suggestions! The app is not designed very good and is not very user friendly and what seems to be straight forward (+ add speaker to group) does not work. Guess I’ll have to try a phone call or wait for the next app update to see if they’re working on any bugs!?

title: My in depth review
text: I have to tell you honestly the first three or four updates that you sent actually screwed it up so bad I had to call you guys to get it working again! Now I have to admit the last two updates have actually improved the way my sound bar works. I am glad to finally received updates that make my stereo work better. Thank you

title: Good Experience
text: Overall, I am having a fair experience with the product and the app. The apps simplicity and limits sort of change the pace of what we are used to but it allows us to focus less on the “remote” that the app acts as and more on what the product produces. I am not sure whether or not the interfaces limited nature is just a Bose thing, but who am I to be disappointed. I’m impressed.

title: Another app that can’t leave well enough alone.
text: This app was running fine, except for the major glitch that when you first open it, it never is able to play more than one speaker at a time. Ive always had to go and select my second speaker manually. Well, with this new update that I did not request but that was forced on me through my phone, it’s now no longer able to find it. It is searching for that second speaker for about five minutes. Very painful when I want to listen to my music without having to sit by my phone to hit the “play all“ button.

title: Unfortunate
text: I’ve been purchasing Bose products for the better part of 3 decades. While the speakers are great, the software supporting the simultaneous use of multiple speakers is awful. I have 3 speakers and it’s a crap shoot how many it will find when I open the app, but it is never all 3. Every time there is an update to the software or speakers ( which is quite frequently) I hope this is the one that will fix this silliness but it never is. My guess is they will never fix this, start a brand new product line that actually works, and leave the old adopters to parish in this swamp of incompetence. I would recommend looking somewhere else for whole house audio.

title: Pretty decent...  jumpy volume
text:
The app has come a long way since it was first introduced. Even though it’s not the easiest to navigate, it does work. 

My biggest problem is when I try to change the volume, sometimes the volume goes full blast and is potentially damaging the speakers. It’s crazy obnoxiously loud, even with just a slight adjustment on the volume slider or the volume buttons on the phone or iPad. This is a major issue that has not been fixed update after update.

title: Great Quality
text: The TuneIn option is so great to use when you just want to turn on the radio quick. Although it would be nice to be able to have a menu to switch radio stations on different preset numbers without having to look up the station and save it manually. Overall, music quality and user friendly access is just perfect for my daily music needs.

title: Awful
text:

title: Needs more stream services
text:
Update: I spend a lot of time trying to get the app to work with the speaker. Often involves reconnecting the speaker through settings. Would give this 3 stars if it added an Alarm functionality 

This speaker looks great and sounds great.  My friends are always impressed with the deep, rich, sound. Using the Bose app really opens up the speakers abilities. I'm impressed with the availability of content from CNN, podcasts, international radio stations, internet radio, and several music streaming services.

title: Sound touch 10 support

title: 80s Alternative
text: I enjoy it very much, brings back the great alternative music.  But I know there are more songs that you can add to the list, from alternative 80s. The problem is that it seems as though a I hear the same songs everyday or maybe it’s every other day.

title: Sound Touch
text:
I love the sound system.  I am running three units in my home on the same floor.  The individual volume controls are a great aid in balancing the sound through the floor where the units reside. 
As to the navigation of the controls, I find it to be less than user friendly.  The previous version was much easier to navigate. And the appearance of the controls is not pleasing to the eye.

title: Bose Sound System APP
text: I have the app on my iPad and iPhone for easy access to my Bose Sound System 30 internet radio.  I can access musical stations all around the world with a simple touch.  The app works perfectly most of the time which is a plus.  Sometimes an issue rests with my internet provider.  Overall, it is an excellent app.

title: Lose connection/can’t find speaker
text: I’m beginning to dislike Bose SoundTouch 30. So annoying to keep on losing or can’t find speaker every time you turn on the system. Never had a problem with this before. If this continues it’s time to find something reliable speakers out there. So disappointed!

title: Keeps telling me to update
text:
The app keeps telling me to update but I’m on the latest version. There is no way for me to download an update from the App Store because I’m on the latest version. So now I just can’t use the app because the “update” modal is blocking the UI. Annoying. 

We have 5 Bose devices throughout our house set up to this system and the app is full of annoying quirks like this. I love the speaker quality but Bose needs to become a software company fast if they’re really going to keep up.

title: Clean. Functional. Missing some things
text:
App works consistently and is easy to navigate. Setup is a snap. But how about a pause/play button in the app when I start playing through Alexa? I need to use the remote or Alexa to do it(hard when music is turned up).

Speaking of Alexa. When use the suggested phrase to “play ——- on all speakers” it prompts the list of speakers every single time, and I need to say “all speakers” again to get it to work. 

Allow for more bass and treble control. 

Ultimately, I bought two Soundtouch 10 and two Sonos Play:1. Sonos Play:1 sound and bass is superior (by far), and cheaper. I am a die-hard Bose fan but I will not blindly reward you for producing a comparably substandard product. I will return the Bose. Sad because your functionality with BT and AUX is so nice.

title: Could be a little more user friendly
text: I love that I can use my phone to play radio, podcasts, or playlists but it's not always intuitive how to go from one to the other. Would also be nice if the app had an option to let the display stay on while it it runs -- like Waze -- so that I can quickly turn down the volume or turn off the speaker.

title: Never buy a Bose
text:
I can never connect my Bose to my WiFi so I can use the system via the app. Once in a blue it will connect but the next time I try to listen to music it will never connect again. I followed every recommendation suggests. 
Every time I turn my Bose system on it will prompt me to connect to my network. After hours of trying and in very rare occasions it will connect. But the next time I try to do it it’s the same problem all over again. 
This was the worst purchase I had ever made wasted $700 on a Bose system that I cannot use. Please do not buy.

title: Good sound if it worked consistently
text: We have 2 Bose sound systems at our gallery. One in the front and one in the back. It’s beyond frustrating. They play fine as one, but it all goes downhill when you try to get them to play the same station as one system, then it works for about 45 min, if that.

title: App works well but could add some features.
text: Easy to control once you get used to it and have the SoundTouch set up right. The things I wished it added was the ability to control the inputs in the app instead of relying on the remote. It would be great to switch to TV via the app and eventually do it with the Alexa app for full control. If it had that that it would be 5 stars.

title: SoundTouch in my opinion
text: I have several BOSE products across the house. Some use SoundTouch, the new ones use BoseMusic.  SoundTouch is always responsive and provides all the control you need. My favorite feature is the AppleWatch app. You can control volume as well as music selection using AppleWatch! Great app!

title: Great idea but doesn’t work
text: SoundTouch is a great concept for a product. Unfortunately it doesn’t work. The app is routinely loses contact with the speakers and so it does absolutely nothing. This problem has existed for years. The bose support forums have thousands of posts about this bug. Their only solution is to reboot the soundtouch and your router. Im not going to do that multiple times a day os the solution is to simply not use the app. Otherwise you’ll spend more time trouble shooting buggy software than it takes to walk across the room and press buttons on the soundtouch.

title: My Review
text:
Congratulations I can see there’s a lot of improvements have been done but still needs to be more improved, what you don’t have to forget is that you’re Bose, your consumers can not be disappointed with you just like how unimaginable it could be that for instance Sony’s consumers be disappointed. 
But so far so good try to do more. 👍🏼👍🏼

title: Bose SoundTouch and lifestyle 650
text: This has been amazing step up from my previous Lifestyle system. It’s very nice to be able from one application on your phone to control all speakers in your house, garden, and backyard. Bose has done very well.  I highly recommend the lifestyle 650 and the sound touch application.

title: Performs well
text: Not much to say here, if you are getting this app that probably means you have some of the speakers. It’s designed well, my one thing that i want is the ability to have multiple “profiles” so that multiple devices can connect to the speakers

title: Nothing but Bose
text: updates in the future. Love the idea that I could play my Apple TV through my soundtouch app. Overpriced? Why can you return your other speakers when they broke down, Bose has there own tech support team. And sometimes it's all about preference too. I respect other brands, but I'm sticking to my Bose.

title: Apple Music
text:
I truly really love my speaker and the application, although there are some things that I wish were available via the app. 

The first example is a sleep timer option, I really enjoy falling asleep to music and it will be nice to have that option.  

I also enjoy the various music channels available but I wonder why of all the streaming services Apple Music is not one of them.

title: SoundTouch 3
text:
The BOSE ST3 provides an awesome listening experience! I have owned the ST3 system for nearly three years and it has been truly a pleasure to hear ALL of my music with such distinct instrumentals and vocals.  The versatility offered with both digital and Bluetooth capabilities make it worth the $$$.
I gave the ST3 a 5-star rating ONLY because there was not a 10-star option!

title: Absolutely Confusing!
text: Apps are supposed to be intuitive and simple.  Not this one!  If you want to change music stations using the app, there is no simple way to do it.  You jump around until you find a screen that has a selection of radio stations and then you can finally go to another station.  Maybe the “experts” at Bose know how this app works, but I think it is almost incomprehensible. title: Bose is Best - 6 year user
text:
I just been very pleased with the Bose sound touch app over the years. The app has undergone many changes and so much improvement over the past 2 years. 

It’s clear Bose cares about its customers and is making a user experience that is best in class. 

Thank you Bose.

title: Buy Sonos
text: Invested in 5 SoundTouch soundbars 3 years ago and now regret. The sound is great, but this app has always felt like outdated tech. title: Bose
text: The Bose sound app is awesome! So versatile and easy to use. I love that you have multiple options to listen to local radio or favorite types of music....even podcasts! So cool. The speaker sounds amazing- huge Bose fan here. I worked for them while in college and have loved there speakers- hands down best quality of sound out there for the price!

title: Great sound , great technology!
text: I am very please with Bose. I bought another system that was “similar” , surround sound in the house with an amp to drive my 4 outdoor speakers. After 2 year of average sound and bad technology, I caved and bought Bose. Sound bar, bass and rear speakers inside and Bose amp outside. Everything works together and the app is the best. title: SOUNDS WONDERFUL!!!!!!
text: I have been wanting a Bose Wave radio for years, but my husband always said no, let’s wait.  Well, he got me Bose speakers for my computer and was so impressed! I LOVE IT!!! I love the sound!!!  Thank you Bose!!!

title: I have owned Bose products for many years.
text:
I have owned Bose products for many years. And these speakers have decent sound. (When They decide to connect)

title: Nothing’s perfect
text: Though nothings perfect, the sound touch system comes close. It beats a costly permanent install sand when needed each speaker is handily portable. title: Good sound.
text: I’m enjoying my new Bose speakers but I can’t seem to make Alexa turn them on.  Sound is good from these and surprising for their size but you have to use them in a space that’s not too large.  I tried one in my living room that is 15’ x 25’ and it wasn’t enough sound.  I definitely would buy again.

title: Bose and SoundTouch=Awesome!
text: Our SoundTouch 10 two pack of speakers has been awesome. It has brought music back to our home! Internet radio is great and playing music from my home computer could not be easier. title: SoundTouch
text: I'm a big fan of Bose products in general. The SoundTouch is pretty outstanding. My only complaint is that The sound touch has to be plugged in at all times. Has a magnificent sound quality the interfaces value is our user-friendly and connectivity to my phone as a remote has been working flawlessly for me.

title: Lacks Documentation, Keeps it From being 5 Star
text:
The lack of good set-up instructions keep the speaker from getting a five star rating.  The set-up info, what there is, are confusing and not well written.  Even going on line and downloading the manual, does not clarify the set-up.  However, after trial and error, I finally have the speaker functioning properly.

The speaker quality is what you expect from Bose.  Even though it is not stereo with just one speaker, the sound is very good in all ranges.

The one button connection to all you media sources streaming over your network is an unexpected plus.

I recommend this speaker.

title: My kind of music
text: It’s a beautiful thing to come home after putting in 12 to 13 hours of stressful work and be able to listen to my own music at the push of a button. Great types that I could never find on any radio station.

title: “Hmmmm...” “OH SNAP!”
text: These “cute” little messages are the way SoundTouch announces its failure to do as it should. title: Love Soundtouch...Waiting on Tidal Integration!

title: Connecting

CA

title: Good system

title: Bose sound bar

title: Amazing clear sound that takes me to a different world! Bose is the best!

title: Offline connection

title: Some Hiccups But I Enjoy My Purchases

title: App needs work.

title: Almost perfect
text: These speakers sound amazing and the are easy to connect via the app. The only issue which is minor, is that the speakers become delayed from the phone. When you have more than one speaker connected, The speaker volume track, skip and rewind all become delayed.

title: Horrible
text: I wish I could leave 0 stars. Worst app I’ve ever used. I love the Bose product. But this app is as big of failure as I’ve ever seen. The app always crashes. title: Great, but frustrating
text: Every time I want to connect to the speaker, I always get an error. I have to do this every time I turn on the speaker or if I hit pause. Very frustrating. Otherwise I would really love this app.

title: Frustrating to use
text: I enjoy the sound I get from these speakers and like having 2 of them to connect but I have to update the app frequently and they still don’t fix the bugs that’s exist. When using the Sound Touch app the speaker intermittently pauses the sound every few seconds. I have tried to reinstall, as well as close the music station and restart. No use. I have to then connect with Bluetooth and then I only get one speaker. It’s very frustrating!

title: Love it. However..
text: After lots of iterations, it seems Bose has finally got the App right, in its features, to match the supreme superb-ness of their sound. Cumbersome and archaic. Why?!

title: Best sound ever...
text:
Soundwave lives up to its name. It’s like riding on a musical wave of sound. It’s so intimate and quite but at the same time embracing intense sound as needed. 
The CD sound is remarkable. I also hooked up a Technics turntable and that vinyl sound is equally refreshing with its warm sound that I’ve missed hearing because of all the digital noise.
Couldn’t be happier with Soundwave.

title: Highly Disappointed

title: Love it but...

title: Inconsistent and slow

title: Mobile App

Great theatre system... absolutely phenomenal... only reason 4 Star is the mobile app is not as intuitive nor has all the features as the remote.

title: Fix the bugs please!!!

title: Operation via phone app is Awesome. Connection establishment is quite slow

title: Love it when...

title: Best Friend Forever

title: Works great!

title: Tom
