title: I love SoundTouch, but why..........!!!!
text:
Everything was fine until the update and now I can’t use TuneIn with Bose, neither can I save it as a preset on my speaker. I like to wake up to MY music choice whether it’s a radio station from Sweden or from Colombia and now I simply can’t.
Please put it back.

title: My precise geo location? Really?
text: I’ve had this speaker for years on the same wi-fi network and the app could “find” the speaker just fine on those rare occasions when I had to re-add the speaker. Now, with the latest app -update - which supposedly addressed “bug fixes” - they need my precise geographic location in maps to add a speaker that is literally 3 feet away and on the same network!?! Info that it never needed before to work just fine.  STOP SPYING ON CONSUMERS!!! I’m so tired of all the data grabbing.

title: Complete garbage. Going to Sonus.
text:
Updates freeze the SoundTouch. Basically impossible to access speaker via home network. And best of all updates blow away your user name and password for things like Sirius. Seriously? Bose calls this software. 

Formerly good company that has lost its way. Bose is the new Sony- once great will be forgotten as better systems pass them. Bye bye Bose.

title: Love the SoundTouch
text: We have 2 SoundTouchs and also have this connected to our tv sound bar - love the way I can play it anywhere in the house and adjust the volume in each room as desired. Only sorry our local Bose store has closed down - they were awesome and fantastic customer service.

title: What a great system!
text: Over the years, I’ve always had massive sound systems in my living room.  When my wife gave me this little box, I was skeptical.  But the sound has proven very full and enjoyable.  Add on top of this the internet radio and Pandora, and I can’t imagine life without this little system

title: Great app - but needs control over TV audio
text:
This is a great app. Love the integration with various content providers but am blown away that there is no way to switch to AUX when working with a $700 SoundTouch 300 bar.  

Having read other reviews - I see this is a long running issue. Just add a flipping AUX circle with the other two options.  

While you’re at it - allow the AUX from one device to be streamed to other speakers! 😉

title: Very Disappointed
text:
Connection issues each and every time I use app. Constantly says searching for speakers. Only way to get WiFi connected is by resetting up the app connection. 

If using Bluetooth the speakers constantly drop connection. 1-2 seconds every few minutes. Very annoying. 

Wish I would have gone with Sonos

title: Sound
text:
I tried other systems and was never happy until I got Bose. 
It's awesome sound. Periodically I get popping sounds in the speakers. So far it's been nothing serious either an update for the speakers or unplug everything then wait a few minutes and start over. That usually clears things up

title: Love It
text:
This system is awesome. It's enabled me to have great music and wonderful sound in my small place that's not overpowering. I hadn't been able to have music in my home for almost two years! I can turn it on and off while laying in my bedroom and it's in my living room! 
AWESOME sound and an easy step by step install guide for "dummies"! Lol
Diane B.

title: I love this system
text:
Easy to set up- the presets are fantastic - sound is good & you don’t have to have WiFi to use it- you can connect in Bluetooth or even a headphone aux, which is great for guests.
We had a SONOS and got rid of it when it had so many limiting features.
BOSE gives you autonomy and good sound quality - love love

title: Stereo Stereo Stereo
text:
Love that I can have 2 SoundTouch 10 working together for stereo sound. Got rid of my SoundTouch 30 because can’t do the same thing :(
Love everything else about SoundTouch & sure more features can be added to make it even better; like adding stereo feature to SoundTouch 20 & 30. Then would be an outstanding 5stars!

title: Not good enough
text: Sorry guys but the app it's not good enough. It's not a internet related issue, there's more time where the app can't find my sound touch 20 than the ones it does. It's a bit annoying when you want to control your speaker from another room and you can't.

title: Amazing speaker- very good app
text: Love that I only have to press a button for SiriusXM(r), HD internet Radio(r), Pandora(r) or even iHeart radio(r). I have the lowest level speaker and find it so easy to use. Better than BlueTooth and internet speaker is a must-have. Wish I had another speaker (more speakers) to join them throughout my rooms and work.

title: It’s okay
text: The Wave Soundtouch system loses wifi connectivity every now and again, but overall reliable.  If Bose could develop WPA security key entry technology for their devices instead of WPS via the app, the connectivity issue would be solved.  I like it for the most part.

title: App never responds
text: Unfortunately this app has failed me many times. It can’t find my speaker and the Pandora acct on it freezes. I’ve tried resetting the speaker as well as the wireless router. It works for a while and then fails again. Not happy with this app but I use my speaker through Bluetooth and then I launch the Pandora app on its own. Through Bluetooth seems to keep the speaker working continuously much better than through this App. Even to turn it on and off I can’t. Good thing it came with a Remote! 😕

title: Awesome soundbar, but
text:
This is really an awesome soundbar, listening to music is great, the bass coming from the subwoofer (?) is very clean and it goes really low. But, the only letdown is the limited hdmi inputs, compared to other brands. I never tried watching bluray movie yet bec it wont let me maybe bec the tv is not hdcp compliant nor UHD. I had all the sony ubp x 800, sky hdmi cable connected .
So, with the limited inputs i’m having a second thoughts.

title: SoundTouch additional features
text: For example, I am unable to change my option in the pandora app from the SoundTouch app.. would love if you guys could write an interface to enable more flexibility of this sort.  Outside of that, the SoundTouch app is very good.

title: Compact beautiful sound
text: I hated to get rid of my big beautiful Sony sound setup, but this little Bose box has wonderful sound and I listen to it much more than my old setup. The remote control makes listening to Pandora quite enjoyable. The problem is that it does not stay connected to the WiFi consistently. Setting it up again is a pain.

title: BOSE soundtouch IV Sound Volume Issue??
text: Does anyone have the same volume issue?  I don’t get any sound until I hit 40.  And then it’s only sufficiently loud enough to hear what’s playing where conversation can be held at a normal volume in a 22 x 22 living room and people are seated around the room.  Absolutely no sound until I hit 40.

title: Incredible app... when it works
text: I love the app and it’s usability when it functions correctly. Some of the updates have on multiple occasions have caused the SA5 head units to go into a update spin. A complete manual power cycle of the unit is needed to restore normal operation. Other than that, I am a big fan of the app and it’s capabilities.

title: SoundTouch Remote
text: The SoundTouch touch performs well, But the remote control needs a lot of improvement. If you drop the remote control even on a carpeted floor the rubber type cover just pops off and you cannot get it to seal properly. It is very annoying that’s such a high-quality speaker has such a poor remote.

title: Bose: where over priced equipment requires a highly limited, mostly defective software to use.
text:
The app updates frequently break connectivity amongst networked components, provide no new functionality, and lead to stubbornly connectivity issues amongst equipment that previously worked without issue. During this time your equipment suffers degraded performance, if usable at all.

The impertinence of this apps poor quality and the problems it creates should be met with regulatory penalties and prohibition from distribution.

title: Great app, would love a few more options
text:
Overall the app is great. I have a Soundbar, Sub, 10 and 20 and this app makes it easy to play different music or the same on all speakers.

The main thing I want is a way to change back to TV input so I don’t have to get the remote every time. 

The beta version of being able to play wired inputs (optical/hdmi) on the 10 and 20 was nice to see. It had fairly significant lag on those speakers but it shows they are updating and adding new features at least. 

Overall I’m very happy with this system over a sonos system. The app helps a lot.

title: Love the sound!
text: I like be the sound these speakers put out but it can be a little confusing when using different internet radio mediums and occasionally it just stops but we think it's because the internet is buffering.  I do recommend to anyone though.

title: Pleasantly Surprised and Impressed
text: Absolutely surprised by the simplicity and clean interface for music selection in control of the Bose SoundTouch. I was already impressed by the Bose and was hoping there was a way to control the unit without having to carry around the device remote. Thanks to the design team for the great app!

title: Barely functional
text: What a piece of crap!  When I launch it, it never can find my speaker the first time. I have to restart, second time usually works. To search for a SiriusXM channel takes 3 clicks, and there are only 6 favorites. Most times I just use the speaker in Bluetooth, forget this app.

title: Terrible software shame on Bose
text:
Bose should be ashamed of this app.  
It’s impossible to search.  You can’t use Apple Music or Tidal.  The Bluetooth component barely works.  Bose you are stealing money come your customers by forcing us to use sub par proprietary software apps.  Invest money in software not just the speakers.  Bad very bad.  Sonos crushes you.  And I don’t even have Sonos just Bose.  Oh well.  Buyers beware.  Software seems like 10 year old tech.  Wish I didn’t have this product but I’m stuck like so many others.

title: Horrible app makes me want to go Sonos
text: This app is horrible that it makes me want to switch to Sonos.  We have a couple Soundtouch 20s and 30s as well as a Lifestyle system in family room.  We it works it is fine.   But everything has to be perfect and I constantly restart the app so it can find my speakers, even when the are streaming.  It is just so unreliable that I really want to make the switch.  And before anyone asks, many of the speakers are next to a router.

title: Was frustrated. Now satisfied.
text: App just made the surround come to life on my SoundTouch300. I’ve had this for almost a year now and upgraded to the side speakers last Christmas. (They we’re a gift). I was pretty bummed with the output. This app updated my sound bar and gave me access to boost the rear speakers a bit. Now they glisten.

title: Horrible App especially given it costs upwards of $200 to buy Bose speakers
text:
The app is missing very basic functionality like wake up alarm, bookmark podcasts ( you can bookmark a total of 6 podcasts/radio stations cumulatively which is a absurdly small number).
The app is constantly disconnected from the speakers while in use.
Often the app status says"finding your speakers" even though both the app and the speakers are connected to the same Wi-Fi network and it's a frustrating experience to use it.

title: Bose gone bad
text: Most of the time, as long as I don’t try to change anything, the app seems to work ok.  Try and edit and the app is worthless.  I’m trying to change the name of my wave radio and it now wants me to connect to WiFi, which it already is.  Try and set the radio locale for music and nothing happens.  This app has been out long enough that these kind of issues should not be there.  Come on Bose, your company is better than this or at least used to be until all your support went overseas.

title: Excellent
text: With Soundtouch app I can control the system from anywhere in the house. I have the app in all my smart devices, phones and tablets. No need to invest outrageous amount on home automation like control4 to automate sound in the house. I plan to expand the sound system to other rooms in the house in few days.

title: Not a Sonos
text:
Good speaker, lousy software! Talk about a company going off the reservation. App Software does not recognize speaker even when its on! When it does recognize it it takes about 5 to 7 minutes to get a hold of it. 

Therefore I cannot turn my speaker on from my iPad, I have to go get the remote and call up the internet setting and my usual radio station comes on, yet the software does not pick it up. At least Sonos has all this figured out.....hint hint to Bose, hire a firm that knows how to do software, and stick to speakers!

title: Great sound and simple to use.
text: Great sound (as expected). Features and options are fantastic. App is easy to use too. Just wish they would release the Alexa Skill already. It would be nice to control the SoundTouch with just your voice and occasionally use it as a Bluetooth speaker for Alexa.

title: Great System!!!!
text: SoundTouch continues to perform exceptionally well. Recently discovered that even the Aux In feature will play throughout the house. I currently have speakers in 4 rooms and have had no issues. The sound quality might not be “audiophile” quality but it serves my purposes completely.

title: Great app for great speakers!
text: I use this app every day with my Bose and love it! So easy to use and I hardly ever have any problems with it. It would be perfect if I could set a timer on how long it stays on (for when I fall asleep) and if it let me select specific stations while using the shuffle feature for Pandora instead of just shuffling everything.

title: Great, besides occasionally having to reset speaker so app can work
text: Speaker and app work great together, I love the ease of handling. Just annoying having to reset the speaker (unplug, then replug) every couple of weeks. For the amount we pay for these speakers, we shouldn’t have to tediously do this every so often.

title: Bose app can recognize its own speaker, finally!
text:
Since last few years, app always had an issue in recognizing Bose speaker connected to same WiFi.
Finally with latest version, it seems to have been fixed!
Bose still can’t play google play music but this is a relief...

title: Bose Sountouch App
text:
The Bose sound touch is great, but the app is terrible.
I have WiFi throughout the House, but the app can’t find my speakers.
I can go thru the motion of resettling by holing them up to the computer, but after a couple days, the app doesn’t work
Bose definitely has to put their Software Engineers to work on it

title: Great start to SoundTouch config
text: A great first step to managing your SoundTouch 300. It would be great to have the ability to change modes (tv vs Bluetooth vs music) I would also like it if you could change the specialty modes like the voice enhanced mode. Otherwise it makes software updates a breeze!

title: Doesn’t connect anymore!
text: This used to be the greatest and was perfect for our little one. With the latest release it won’t connect to our speaker at least half the time even when the speaker is already on. Very frustrating.

title: Extremely Satisfied
text:
My Wife and I have had our SoundTouch for as long as there has been SoundTouch. We are both extremely satisfied and with new features added regularly, we are even more happy. Thank you for this opportunity to share our thoughts.

Sincerely,
heatman5

title: Amazing sound...easy set up
text: My music has never sounded better. I love that I can continue listening to my favorite playlist throughout every room in the house. The speaker app set up was very user friendly and I had my speakers ready less then a few minutes!

title: Getting better all the time
text: This app came with my Bose wireless system, and it really is great. I can control my music from any connected device, including my phone. It accesses all online music sources, plus my own music library on either phone or computer. Very easy to use.

title: One Request to Make a Great Product Greater
text: I absolutely love Pandora. The only wish I have is that would like to have multiple shuffles. Kind of like playlists of Pandora station. This way I could have instrumental classical, opera, jazz, etc. shuffle groups. Thanks for a wonderful product.

title: Clock (Time Display on Product)
text:
The time displayed faithfully for three years straight and now has vanished and no matter what I try ... won’t come back up on the product. Otherwise the product and app work well.

- TRenderiings

title: Effective, but too many traps to operate
text: The app is clean and effective. It works better with Pandora than other sources. The issue is it takes too many taps to navigate. If you are going to select a station and leave it, then the app is great. If you want to move between stations and update song ratings it can become a chore.

title: Bose delivers smooth noise to our ears!!!
text:
First thing we do every morning is turn on our Bose SoundTouch System. It echoes throughout the house while the kids wake up and get ready for school and the adults get ready for work. Good tunes from our favorite Pandora stations (Ray Lamontagne & The Band)!!! Works like a charm!!!!

The Mann Family

title: Great but not perfect
text: I can’t connect my Alexa to play simultaneously with the Bose speaker, however everything else with this speak is incredible. Always the quality sound, phenomenal range and pristine clarity. I just hope this becomes linked with other tech in a easier manner soon.

title: Love SoundTouch
text: Somewhat difficult to get my iTunes library on my Windows based computer to play through the SoundTouch system. Once I got it to work it’s made up for all the pain and angst to get there.  Now that it’s done I think there could be a simpler set of instructions put out by Bose to make the process easier the next time.

title: Sound!
text: Love the sound. Love the size. Never thought I’d get such great sound from such a compact size. Having been married to a audio snob, I’ve owned the “best” audio equipment and barely had room for my furniture. Thank you for making life so much easier and roomy. I hope to by another one for my bedroom.

title: One of the best gifts
text: I'm a diehard TV addict and I'm retired if it wasn't for the boss SoundTouch I'd be watching TV all day. My oldest manages a Bose store and gave me this and now I spend most of my days working around the house and the Bose SoundTouch is on all the time. I just wish I had two more, one for the bedroom and one for the garage that I use as a workshop.

title: Necessary app when you have Bose speakers
text: Easy to use app, allows all controls to the speakers, without the remote... pretty good when you are just too lazy to get off the couch, or a sudden need strikes to listen to something immediately, but you are in a different room or something 😊

title: Soundtouch experience
text: I never give anything 5 stars, but the sound touch deserves every one of them.  I have to say though that I also have the bass and the two rear speakers to compliment. A little pricey, but worth every penny. If you set this up correctly, the best system out there today!

title: Updates
text: I have owned the SoundTouch for several years.  With each patch and upgrade the system works better and easier.  I have 6 units throughout my house.  They can all play at one or individually. Love the system.  Great sound

title: Volume Cut Out When Slider is Used
text:
Every time I raise and lower the volume from my phone’s control center or using the slider in the Music app it results in music completely cutting out for about 3-5 seconds. 

I can only control the volume with my phone’s physical volume buttons to avoid the sound dropping.

This is really honestly very lame and doesn’t happen with any other speaker I or my friends have.

title: Single song selection
text: Hello SoundTouch. I love the Bose speakers and the app, I would appreciate it if the app would let me select an actual song and here it,  instead of only giving me a genre of similar sounding songs and waiting for god knows how long to here the actual song I requested. Thanks

title: No more technical issue!
text: I have been using sound touch for almost 3 years. At the beginning, there were some issues of frequent disconnecting but I knew Bose would improve the quality so I waited with patience and now no more disconnecting issue. Thumbs up!

title: Ok but still needs work
text: I’ve had a new bose sound link III for about two months now. It’s worked generally fine however I cannot operate the speakers with this app. Every time I open the app, my speakers need to update, progress stays at 0% with no explanation of what it’s trying to do. It’s gotten quite frustrating since I know it’s not a connection issue, but more of a developer issue.

title: Works great! Upgrade Wi-Fi and issues fixed
text: A lot of the negative reviews I see on here are due to poor Wi-Fi signal or Wi-Fi system. Working in IT, I’ve worked with all Bose systems extensively and almost 99% of our issues were solved by upgrading our networking equipment on both enterprise and residential consumer.

title: I love Bose!
text: Wow. I had no idea how much I would enjoy this system when I purchased it. It is way more than I expected. I have been listening to radio from all over the world in amazement. It links to Pandora, Apple Music, and more. This is an outstanding value and you will love it. Enjoy!

title: App does excellent, except for iTunes Playlist
text:
Internet streaming performs great, much better than Google chromecast and other devices that time out streaming.
The App is intuitive and easy to setup/control Bose speakers.

An improvement needed: my iTunes Playlist ends playback 5 minutes (in about 1.5 songs).  Making this robust will give this 5 stars

title: Read before purchasing any Bose products!
text: Bose has neglected to fix a major issue with the ST300 and its app. There is no way to switch inputs from music to TV (aux) via the app.  Basically, if your Bose soundbar is playing music from your phone, it is impossible to use the app to switch the soundbar back to TV audio from your app. This renders the app basically useless if you plan on using your soundbar for both TV and music. Why spend thousands on a Bose ecosystem when the most basic tasks cannot be executed from the app.

title: At witt’s end
text: I have 4 SoundTouch 10’s. I have great wifi coverage. I simply cannot get the Play All to work. I have gone around and around resetting the wifi connections. But i am embarrassed that i can't get all 4 of them to fill my house with sound. Clearly the app is set up to make this happen. But no joy. We wanted to get 2 more speakers for the other rooms but without being able to stream audio through them, what’s the point?  Each speaker will play. But can't get whole house sound. Awful.

title: Nice sound
text: I purchased the sound touch 10 and 30.  Both sound great, but I’m having issues with connecting the 30 to my app via the network.  The 10 speakers work fine through network.  The application needs a little work.

title: Love it
text: The functions on it work great. The only problem I've had was just after playing for 30 min. or so it just stop playing. But after playing around it I discovered changing the preset station it start back playing again.

title: Sound Touch Rocks
text: Sound Touch app for my Bose system works amazingly well. Love the interface and the support for pandora. The wireless connectivity makes all the difference, no more distance limitations using blue tooth. I can control my system while out in the yard. Highly recommend

title: Updates don’t work
text: App tells me I need an update and takes me to App Store but there’s no way to force an update - it just opens the app again so it can tell me it needs an update. Very annoying. Tried to contact app support but the link from the App Store doesn’t work.

title: Stop the Mandatory Updates
text: While I appreciate updates and improvements I absolutely hate that they're mandatory. I had a wedding this weekend I used four of them synced together for nice background music. During setup I had one playing then as I plugged in the rest they would play but the stupid update window would not go away until you allowed the update. Please add a “later” button!!!

title: No music from my phone? No Apple Music?
text: Used a Sono system at the beach house we rented which worked awesome so I thought I would give our Bose WiFi SoundTouch a try again. We have 5 speakers throughout the house and now I remember why we don use them with WiFi and only Bluetooth ... no ability to play music from our iPhones nor can you add Apple Music to your service!? This system is trash which is a shame because no one makes better speakers than Bose!

title: Please add iPad Slideover / Splitview Support
text: I use SoundTouch for whole-home audio in 6 zones with 6 SA-5 amplifiers and it serves its purpose. However, I use wall-mounted iPads to control the audio alongside my HomeKit automation. This app really needs to add slideover and split view support on iPadOS so I don’t have to go home every time to open the app. Please add so I can have the Home app and soundtouch open simultaneously on my iPads.

title: Probably the worst app
text: Terrible connectivity with iphones. Anytime there’s an update, I hope it’ll work....but it doesn’t. Can’t find the speaker....ever. Works ok as a Bluetooth speaker that’s not portable, at all, but is otherwise disappointing. I’ve owned this speaker for 2+ years and it has impressive sound for such a small speaker....but seriously Bose! Figure this stuff out! Seems like for the price you pay, the app should work. Not sure I’ll buy a Bose product again.

title: Always needs updates :(
text: Ugh- I have the SoundTouch system and app but every time I open it to play music across speakers it needs an update. Won’t let you continue without updating. Updating takes 20 minutes!!! Literally every time. If you actually want a system you can use I would get something else until they can keep the system stable and not require updates every time you want to use it.

title: Phenomenal!
text: The Bose experience with the Wave system is unlike anything I have ever experienced. It’s like stepping into this wonderful world of sound and never wanting to come out. I learn new tips every day. This is the best Bose purchase that I have ever made (and I have made quite a few). I absolutely adore this system.

title: I really want this to work
text: Have had this for about 2 years. It sits on a shelf inside my media closet next to the router. Seems like every other time I have to reconnect the system. Really really annoying . Once connected, sounds and functions great! I bought top of the line Bose ceiling speakers and spent over 2k on my set up. I shouldn’t have cliches every other use. Bose you need to fix this! I’m writing this review as I once again have to reconnect system 😒

title: No longer works
text: This worked fine for a year until the most recent update. Now it only plays about 10 minutes before disconnecting. In order to get it working again, you have to disconnect your router and restart it, and reconnect your speaker to your WiFi. Total aggravation!

title: Everything sounds better with Bose!
text: Started with a Lifestyle 12 many years ago. Wanted to downsize footprint but not quality. Bought the Soundtouch 120 system. Love that I can stream Pandora or internet radio, play “my” music from the desktop, or kick up the tv experience.

title: Hard to love
text: I still think the interface is hard to manage. Does not work on my iPad. But I love the sound and flexibility. Unstable sometimes on wifi. I have two additional sound touch speakers with my 2014 Lifestyle home theater system and a red portable. And of course I love the sound.

title: Can’t control
text: I have a SoundTouch 300 and this app is unable to find my speaker 90 %of the time. And it would not be such a big problem but the speaker has not buttons so if you miss place your remote it’s useless. They need to fix this app ASAP . Cause as of now it’s a hot pile of garbage.

title: Great Sound, Horrible App
text: The app is completely useless for troubleshooting.  Once again, Bose leads the league is fantastic speakers and completely fails at everything else.  Every time I need to connect my wireless Bose speakers to the soundbar it requires me to completely setup the wifi connection again and then again and then again.  Redundant and annoying.  Horrible confusing interface with nearly useless speaker control features.  Fail.

title: It’s an awesome App
text:
I really love the app, works very good, the concept is awesome and easy to use.
I give it 4 stars because is missing Apple Music service.
Also For me just need an update to be able to switch inputs to other than Bluetooth and SoundTouch for other devices like TV, Games etc, make it a full remote control of the SoundTouch device.

title: Bose SoundTouch
text: I am a real Bose fan! I purchased this radio last year as a gift to myself and absolutely love it.  It was tough getting connected at first but upgrades and updates have made this so very easy. I highly recommend.  Did I mention that the sound is unsurpassed?  Well it is😉😀

title: This app could be so much better
text:
Missing couple other popular music services such as SoundCloud and Mixcloud, also at times having trouble finding my speaker on the first try even though it is set up with a static IP address on my network.. 
all and all the app has improved since I used it the first time. 
I love my BOSE SoundTouch 20!

title: Amazing app
text: I love the app, the only complaint I have is that I'm unsure when I need to update my system, I hope I would get a push notification telling me that I need to update. Other than that this is an amazing app and anyone that has a SoundTouch system should get this app asap

title: Bose app & system is a total failure
text: I've tried to connect my speakers over and over again this last app update destroyed this system.... in called bose multiple times and the same answer it's fixed only to find out 20min later no speakers they don't sync for longer than 10min. SAVE YOUR MONEY AND BY SONOS NOT BOSE ITS NOT READY FOR PRIME TIME. WHAT A BIG KET DOWN BY BOSE DISGUSTING.

title: Last update earned Soundtouch an extra star
text: This app sucked for three years but the latest update changed everything for the better...but improvements are still needed so don't stop improving and you can earn that 5th star

title: WTFO!
text:
Why did you break something that worked?  Why should I pay for crap on an app or service when I had what I wanted???!!!!

This is a load of crap!  Fix it now you idiots!

now ios14 has killed soundtouch! it won’t even load!

title: No more complaints
text: With the new update Yes Yes Yes you can now connect via apple play.  Ohh and yeah you can connect multiple speakers through apple play.  It integrates the apple platform and bose seamlessly.  Finally they listen.  Now hopefully there aignt no reneging and messing up a great thing.

title: Big step up
text: The size belies the nice full sound these speakers delver. I have 3 around the house and plan on at least one or two more. I just need to figure out how to get the tv sound to play though this great system. Other than that I would give it a 5/5

title: Glitchy
text: This app works only sometimes.  It has issues connecting to my speaker. When it does connect, it shows what’s playing, allows me to control the volume, yet keeps displaying a message it can’t connect. It also keeps disconnecting the speaker from the WiFi.  Expected better from Bose.
